story:
Project Summary:

In the heart of Philadelphia’s Mt. Airy neighborhood - a community nationally recognized for its diversity- lies over an acre of vacant space next to the local library.  Mt. Airy USA is partnering with the Free Library of Philadelphia to transform this space into a vibrant public park that will enliven our developing commercial corridor, Germantown Avenue, by providing new spaces to read, relax with friends, and enjoy outdoor performances and special events. 

Lovett Park is situated between two distinct sections of the Germantown Avenue corridor, one that has been revitalized in the last ten years with new restaurants and retail, the other still grappling with vacancy and blight. By attracting people from all walks of life to linger outdoors with their neighbors, the park will bridge these two nodes and increase pedestrian activity along the entire corridor.

This summer a popular free summer movie series, "Moonlight Movies in Mt. Airy," will return to the Lovett Library Park for the third time. Moviegoers can also look forward to "Dining Under the Stars," which brings pop-up food trucks and carts to the site to serve dinner and snacks from 6:30-8:30 before the films start. These events make the pefect summer date or family night, and they've also been key to building momentum for the ultimate park renovation project by drawing people to an otherwise empty space. This year, we'd like to make them even better by purchasing some permanent furnishings for the park.

To learn more about the Lovett Park Project, visit HERE  

 

What We Need & What You Get:

Mt. Airy USA needs to raise $6,000 to purchase the beautiful, durable outdoor cafe tables and chairs that are part of our long-term design plan for the park. These funds will be leveraged by private donations that have already been secured. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

While it may take several years to raise all of the funds needed to complete the entire park renovation, we can start with this 'mini-phase' right now!

We're offering some great perks at various contribution levels, including:

  • Picnic dinner for 4 from local Mt. Airy restaurants. Pick it up on a Friday evening and bring it to Lovett Park to enjoy at the tables and chairs you helped purchase! Stick around for the movie!
  • Picnic Basket with utensils
  • Special recipe book from local chefs
  • Dessert for 2 from our rotating cast of Dining Under the Stars sweet vendors.
  • A Go Mt. Airy T-shirt
  • Set of Go Mt. Airy cups
  • Special Lovett Park bookmark

The Impact

The furnishings will be placed in the park before June 21st, when our "Moonlight Movies" and "Dining Under the Stars" series begins.

You'll be able to start enjoying the fruits of your contribution immediately this summer! What a great feeling it will be to relax outside with friends while eating dinner or lunch together. But what's even better is that you're contributing to something with lasting impact. These furnishings will be used in our new community park for years to come as it continues to develop and grow!

Mt. Airy USA (MAUSA) is an experienced organization with a long-standing commitment to the revitalization of the Germantown Avenue corridor and the Mt. Airy neighborhood.  Our commercial corridor and real estate development activities have leveraged millions of dollars in private and public investment to Mt. Airy, attracted numerous new businesses, created hundreds of jobs, and substantially increased property values. Our comprehensive approach to corridor revitalization includes physical improvements, marketing and promotion, and business retention and recruitment activities. We recently completed a streetscape improvement project on The Avenue to install new pedestrian-scale lighting, sidewalks, curbs, trees and benches.  Over the past ten years, we have assisted over seventy business and commercial property owners to complete storefront renovations and launched the Mt. Airy Business Improvement District to provide street cleaning and beautification.

MAUSA believes that transforming the physical environment into beautiful, value-added and active space can change human behavior and improve the day-to-day quality of life of the people around it.  We also believe that people take added care of space they can be proud of and feel invested in. This has been proven qualitatively and quantitatively. 

Now that Germantown Avenue's sidewalks and storefronts have been improved, we see the development of public spaces like Lovett Park as a key next step in our endeavor to improve neighborhood quality of life and grow the local economy.  

Other Ways You Can Help:

Help us spread the word about this campaign!  

  • Use the share tools on Indiegogo to get the word out to your networks on social media.
  • Post about the project and how exciting it is (don't forget to tag Go Mt. Airy and Mt. Airy USA).
  • Talk to your friends about the project and see if they'd like to be a part of it.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
There once was an amazing woman who worked really hard taking care of visitors to her beautiful country. Her job often takes her far away from her beloved son, but she doesn't mind, because she knows she will send him to get the best education to paint the brightest future for her smart and kind son.

She knows a lot of people from around the world, and just needs a bit of help in order to complete the tuition charges so her son can make new friends, get to the new classes and finally meet his lovely new teachers.

A little of help will go a long way for the amazing Kenyan family.

Please donate generously to help us raise the money - the goal is 300$ USD per semester.

Unice's friends

story:
From New York to Naka...JAPAN, THAT IS!

Hi, I'm Tanya! In just a few short weeks I'll be leaving my home, my parents and my friends to live in Japan and teach English to school children. I need your help to make this transition. I've exhausted all other options and unfortunately my parents aren't able to assist me. Without these funds, I won't be able to go to Japan at all.

In 2011, I graduated from Sarah Lawrence College, having majored in Japanese Language. I started studying Japanese from the start of my enrollment, and for my junior year I studied abroad in Kyoto with the Kyoto Consortium for Japanese Studies. It was an amazing experience. And though I was happy that my Japanese had improved, I was more so fortunate to have been a part of the culture (even if only for a year) and grateful for the generosity of the people around me.

This time around, things will be a little different. The JET Program (Japan Exchange and Teaching Program) is a well-known and prestigious organization that connects people from all over the world to schools all over Japan. It was highly recommended by all of my Japanese teachers and tutors while I was in college. I'll be living on the island of Shikoku in a city named Naka, and will be working full-time as an assistant English teacher.

JET is great because the main components are done for us; housing is found for us (though we do pay rent) and our jobs are set up and waiting for us. There is also a wonderful support system and alum network.

What I Need & What You Get

My campaign is to raise money to help my transition process. The amount that I'm asking for is the amount the program suggests we arrive in Japan with, as it will be about a month before we get our first paycheck. So, we'll be responsible for our rent, utilities, travel expenses, and food.

In return, you get anything from a thank you on the social network of your choosing to a personalized package shipped to you with various goodies from Japan (there will probably be tasty snacks included, just saying).

ANYTHING HELPS! I only ask that you give what you won't miss, and I wouldn't ask if I didn't need to. If you can't give at all, I just ask that you please spread the word.

The Impact

This is important to me for many reasons, some of which I can't even express. I'm looking to start a new life doing something I'm very passionate about and in a place I am greatly interested in. I hope that through donating, you all feel like you're a part of this, too.

THANK YOU!

story:
MCIF Center has provided English as a Second Language (ESL) courses since 1993. While the program began informally on the third floor of a school building in Bushwick, Brooklyn, our ESL curriculum has always focused on the value of our learners’ life experiences as the starting point. Throughout the years, MCIF began to offer more levels of instruction and the program has grown to include five levels of English ranging from Beginner to Advanced, computer-based instruction hours, and individual literacy assistance.

In addition to formal class instruction, MCIF Center enhances our participants’ English education and public speaking skills through English presentations throughout the academic year. Celebrations at the Center include Thanksgiving, Christmas, Mother’s Day, and International Women’s Day.

ESL Computer Component

Each English class utilizes MCIF Center’s state-of-the-art computer lab with a variety of ESL software programs once per week. Participants learn to navigate the internet while gaining English skills through online activities.

ESL Literacy Component

MCIF participants who have difficulty reading and writing in their own language are able to receive one-on-one assistance with the MCIF Literacy Instructor once per week. The One-On-One Literacy component of the ESL program aims enhance our participants’ ability to read and write in English.

As a pilot program in the ESL program, Level 4 ESL participants visit lower level classrooms to facilitate discussions and lead other exercises. MCIF Center believes that peer teaching/learning is incredibly valuable for both higher and lower level English learners.

Education Beyond the Classroom

The Open Arms Project addresses our participants’ needs outside of the English classroom. Through our partnerships with other community-based organizations and city agencies, our participants obtain valuable knowledge to support their lives in a holistic way.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to fund our amazing ESL Program!  We are raising money to employ an additional instructor, weekend classes, and new study materials for ESL in the Brooklyn community. All funds raised will go directly to the instructor's salary and purchasing new reading materials and study guides for our participants.  Since we mainly assist lower-income individuals, this money is not only integral, but incredibly necessary. 

In return for your generous donations, we will provide various gifts fom handmade jewelry to Yankee baseball games.

The Impact

This project is invaluable to the Brooklyn community, as we ensure that ESL classes are available and affordable to anyone interested, whether a long-term resident of New York or a first-time visitor to the United States.  Our goal is a fully integrated, dynamic, and diverse population who can communicate freely, obtain jobs and education without discrimination, and succeed in our society.  Your donations will directly make this possible and we cannot thank you enough.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you cannot donate, but if you could please help spread the word, it would be greatly appreciated! All you gotta do is use this link and spread the love! Thanks so much from everyone at MCIF!
story_txt:
MCIF Center has provided English as a Second Language (ESL) courses since 1993. While the program began informally on the third floor of a school building in Bushwick, Brooklyn, our ESL curriculum has always focused on the value of our learners’ life experiences as the starting point. Throughout the years, MCIF began to offer more levels of instruction and the program has grown to include five levels of English ranging from Beginner to Advanced, computer-based instruction hours, and individual literacy assistance.
In addition to formal class instruction, MCIF Center enhances our participants’ English education and public speaking skills through English presentations throughout the academic year. Celebrations at the Center include Thanksgiving, Christmas, Mother’s Day, and International Women’s Day.
ESL Computer Component
Each English class utilizes MCIF Center’s state-of-the-art computer lab with a variety of ESL software programs once per week. Participants learn to navigate the internet while gaining English skills through online activities.
ESL Literacy Component
MCIF participants who have difficulty reading and writing in their own language are able to receive one-on-one assistance with the MCIF Literacy Instructor once per week. The One-On-One Literacy component of the ESL program aims enhance our participants’ ability to read and write in English.
As a pilot program in the ESL program, Level 4 ESL participants visit lower level classrooms to facilitate discussions and lead other exercises. MCIF Center believes that peer teaching/learning is incredibly valuable for both higher and lower level English learners.
Education Beyond the Classroom
The Open Arms Project addresses our participants’ needs outside of the English classroom. Through our partnerships with other community-based organizations and city agencies, our participants obtain valuable knowledge to support their lives in a holistic way.


What We Need & What You Get
We need your help to fund our amazing ESL Program!  We are raising money to employ an additional instructor, weekend classes, and new study materials for ESL in the Brooklyn community. All funds raised will go directly to the instructor's salary and purchasing new reading materials and study guides for our participants.  Since we mainly assist lower-income individuals, this money is not only integral, but incredibly necessary.  
In return for your generous donations, we will provide various gifts fom handmade jewelry to Yankee baseball games.


The Impact
This project is invaluable to the Brooklyn community, as we ensure that ESL classes are available and affordable to anyone interested, whether a long-term resident of New York or a first-time visitor to the United States.  Our goal is a fully integrated, dynamic, and diverse population who can communicate freely, obtain jobs and education without discrimination, and succeed in our society.  Your donations will directly make this possible and we cannot thank you enough. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if you cannot donate, but if you could please help spread the word, it would be greatly appreciated! All you gotta do is use this link and spread the love! Thanks so much from everyone at MCIF!

story:
US

We are Jonathan and Celeste Barnard and we have been working with kids for the last 15 years. On December 31st of last year we left our job, sold our house, and moved in with my parents to work on building a Ranch, Farm, and Camp for families and kids. A place we call BIG RED'S RANCH

BIG RED

It's named after Big Red, our puppet mascot. He represents the kids we want to focus on helping. Big Red is one of those kids who is starved for attention, he interrupts and acts crazy, his dad is not involved in his life. We want to help kids who many schools, churches, and even parents aren't sure what to do with. We want to build a place for all families and kids, but most importantly a place for all the Big Red's in this world!

BIG RED FOUNDERS

We can't do this alone, we need people like you to become founders with us. Founders of Big Red's Ranch and founders of a movement to Fight for the Fatherless. The hardest part of doing anything is starting it. We have potential large gifts and even grants but we need to be established and functioning. We need people who will believe in us even when we don't have much to show them so that we can get up and running and gain momentum. We need Big Red Founders like you!

THE PLAN

Through this Indiegogo project we want to raise money to help us start getting some momentum. We are working to purchase a ranch in the Rio Grande Valley (Texas) as our base but my vision is to have multiple locations accross the country. You can find more information at http://bigredministries.org and you can follow Big Red's Summer at http://helpbigred.com

 

We wil use the money from this project for three things:

  1. Events. We want to do a Father/Son Campount, a Father/Daughter retreat, and a Family event this fall. These events will help us get moving forward and will illustrate some of the things we want to do at the Ranch. We have hosted Father/Son campouts in the past and they always encourage dads who are not involved to to get invloved in their sons lives. We will have sponsors for kids who need them and we will make sure that extra care are given to these kids throughout the weekend.
  2. Earnest money toward the purchase of the ranch. In order to negotiate a contract on a property earnest money will be required.
  3. Operating Costs. We would like to join a camp association and get some advice and consulting. We would like to do more advertising to get the word out on what we are doing.

COLLECTIBLES AND FUN

We think Big Red is aaaaaaaawesome and we hope you do too! We will continue to add fun items and collectibles throughout the campaign so check back often to be part of the fun! Also once we have all the details for our events this will be one of the places you can sign up and pay or pay for a child to attend.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN PARTNER WITH US

I know that God has called us to give you an opportunity to be a part of what He is doing. If you can help us by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, through E-mail and even just talking about it that would help us so much! We added the $2 "We're cheering for you!" gift because every dollar counts and just knowing you support us even if you can't give more, encourages us! I believe God is asking us to do our little and let Him do the miracle.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP AND SUPPORT! Please let us know if you have any questions. jonathan@bigredsranch.com

story:
If You Can Walk, You Can Dance...

My name is Leigh Gaymon-Jones, and I am inspired by the intersection of social justice, community-buidling and creative movement.

I have been engaging in Community Dance for at least 6 years, and along the way I have learned a lot about movement and community engagement. Now it's time for the next leg of this journey! In the fall, I will move to London, England to deepen my study of Community Dance at the Trinity Laban Conservatoire of Music and Dance as a student in the Postgraduate Diploma in Community Dance Program. I am excited to return to the States upon completion of my degree, to share creative movement with a diverse mix of people in a wide range of communities. But to get there, I need community support. 

After earning a BA from Temple University in African-American Studies, Psychology and Spanish, I found myself drawn towards dance. I followed my impulse and relocated to my hometown, Austin, to study contemporary dance, improv and choreography at Austin Community College with some of Austin's premiere dance artists -- Darla Johhson, Allison Orr, Kathy Dunn Hamrick and Jose Bustamante. I was introduced to the idea of dance as a social justice and community-building tool when I attended two of Urban Bush Women's Summer Leadership Institutes (with an emphasis on Black communities), two of the Dance Exchange's summer dance intensives (with an emphasis on intergenerational dancers) and a workshop with Body Shift, here in Austin (with an emphasis on dancers of all physical abilities). 

I have continued to work in Community Dance by working with Forklift Danceworks as a Leaps and Bounds creative movement teacher, stage managing The Trash Project and co-choreographing New Grrl Order, the opening to the 2012 Fusebox Festival. I have also explored a wide range of approaches to creating movement by performing with local artists including Jean Claude Lessou, Christina Sukhgian Houle, Ellen Bartel and Heloise Gold. 

Help me to develop my dance tool kit so that I can share dance with everyone!

Breaking Down the Steps

Even with a partial scholarship from Laban, I have yet to secure the remaining $17,000 of my tuition. Although my total living costs for the year are $37,000  (tuition, housing, food, transportation, books & supplies ), I am only asking for $15,000 in this campaign to cover the following: 

  • Housing:$9000 
  • Portion of Tuition: $6000

Dance with Me!

I realize that everyone can't contribute to every exciting project on indiegogo, so if you're not able to contribute financially, and you still want to support my dream... please spread the word! Tell your friends, your family, post my link on facebook!

Happy dancing!

story:
WHO WE ARE

We are Thao and Julie, the two sophomores from Cornell College (IA).  We would like to start with a simple story which inspired us to do what we are doing today.

The story

Coming back to Vietnam for the summer vacation, we happened to have the chance to work with one of the UNICEF Next Generation Vietnam’s projects.  A brief talk by a member of Next Gen’s Steering Committee made us think.  He told us a scene from a movie he saw recently: A building was on fire and a man was stuck in there, waving his hands out of the windows for help. A woman standing across the street saw that and yelled: “Somebody do something.” Another voice replied: “You are somebody. Do something!”

The story has been embedded in our minds.  We have been thinking over and over again that very simple yet impactful message: “In life we often wonder why somebody doesn’t do something. Then we realize that we are that somebody” (anonymous) We can help the children from different corners of the country and the world who are suffering from the lack of fresh water or dying from preventable causes like diarrhea, measles, or polio…etc.

The awakening

 Growing up healthily and living a comfortably life, we hardly thought of paying much attention to what other children are suffering from.  However, the program that we joined this summer with UNICEF offered us a solution; therefore, we aspired to start a UNICEF chapter at Cornell College to share our experience and to bring more knowledge about children to other people, starting from the small environment where we are living: Cornell campus.  And that’s why we are here, trying to make this happen: A UNICEF Initiative Club called Believe in ZERO-Cornell for UNICEF, to join the global wave of achieving the mission: “ZERO” children dying from preventable causes and suffering from lacking necessities.  We are currently going through the process to be officially recognized by the UNICEF U.S Fund and also by Cornell Student Senate.

WHY WE ARE HERE- WHAT YOU CAN HELP

 For any clubs to run successfully, skills and passion are pivotal.  Luckily, we see an opportunity to learn the essential skills and to kindle our passion through workshops, training and keynote speakers at the UNICEF Initiative Summit 2013.  We are hoping to send three of our student leaders to this summit, incluing Thao Luu, Jess Reed, and me.  Unfortunately, since we had the idea of starting our club in the summer, we are unable to call for a great budget for airfares from our Student Senate.  We thus would like to ask for help from the community to raise a fund of $1,500 for the three members of the executive board to attend this great summit.

In addition to workshops and keynotes, we will also have a chance to participate in the two: a Trick-or-Treat for UNICEF extravaganza, which will take place throughout New York City, and an Emergency Simulation that will allow us to experience a day in the life of a UNICEF field staff member.

With all those great activities at the Summit, we are sure that our student leaders will learn a lot to educate and impact our peers and our community afterwards, allowing us to fulfill the missions of our UNICEF Initiative Club as well as UNICEF worldwide.  We would greatly appreciate your support to help us reach our goals.

 

With sincere gratitude,

Believe in Zero-Cornell for UNICEF co-founders

story:
Join our campaign to fund a proven math education tool that helps both children and adults, finally, “get” math.

It can even help improve the performance of those that are doing well with math! 

FUNdamentallyMath has been used by a select few over the last two decades to increase their performance by up to two grade levels.  It’s now time to upgrade and put it on the Internet so that everyone has a chance to access it.

What is It?

FUNdamentallyMATH, in its original form, is a proven, powerful math software tool that has helped children and adults understand mathematics.  It covers the full suite of math from the basics of 1+1 through advanced algebra (Calculus  to be added)

A select few have used this product to improve performance by up to two grade levels in less than 3 months, and now it is time to  give everyone a chance to do the same.  

Why is FUNdamentallyMATH important?

According to the National Center for Education Statistics in the US, “The Nation’s Report Card, Mathematics 2011”, 59% of all 4th and 66% of 8th graders lacked proficiency in math.  Although this is a slowly improving trend it means that over 36 million of the  61 million students in kindergarten through high school cannot demonstrate competency over challenging subject matter at their grade level.  Proficient has also been defined as solid academic performance for each grade assessed. 

These results are not significantly different from the 2005 results, which also reported outcomes by race.  When reviewed by race, over 90% of African American, 60% of White, 84% of Hispanic, and 80% of American Indian students lacked math proficiency. This level of proficiency should be significantly improved based on the pervasiveness of technology and other science and math related changes in the way we work and live. 
The coding for this product is very complex and requires the developer to be proficient in mathematics. The funds we raise during our campaign will go towards upgrading the program for Internet access, and incorporating the content into a serious-game platform that will allow collaboration among users.  Funds will also be used to set-up the infrastructure of the business including a new website and back office operations to support user subscriptions and track performance, and nationwide Public Relations and Marketing.

A formal study conducted by the University of North Carolina, showed that FUNdamentallyMATH was effective to the 95th percentile and helped users increase their raw end of grade scores by over 20 points with one hour a week use over ten weeks. This is a winning solution to a generational issue! Visit our Life Blog to learn more www.LiveForResults.blogspot.com


What's Required?

 The full cost of product development exceeds $3 million, but this initial infusion will help us accomplish the following:

-Upgrade the existing product and create an Internet-based subscription service with back-office support and structure (8-11 months) (45% )

-Complete Phase I of the Serious-Game: currently includes completion of game design, incorporating key performance measures and preparing for initial release of basic math and/or middle school math. (45%)

-Website Portal including smart performance tracking and licenses(5%)

-Nationwide Public Relations and Marketing for the Launch of the Upgrade and phase I of game (5%)

If we don’t reach our goal, we will focus on completing the upgrade and doing a slower national roll-out.  But, we hope you will help us get all the way there!  We plan to use revenue from the Upgrade to fund completion of the serious, non-violent game.

Please share this campaign with your friends as we really want to make a difference in education. Become a Founding Customer by referring enough people to reach a total contribution of $100 or more.  Thanks for your support.


Perks

Because your contribution is helping us accomplish something very valuable, we want to give you something valuable.  With your contribution of $20 or more, you will receive a copy of the e-book, Live For Results: From Purpose to Plan to Destiny (In addition to other perks based on your giving).  This biblically-based book is a definitive process for discovering your unique purpose and developing a plan for how to achieve it through each area of your life. The tools in this book can help make sure you are on the right path with your life and doing the right things rather than the expected things.   Visit our Life Blog to learn more.  www.LiveForResults.blogspot.com

story:
My story

Hello! Ciao! Hola! :D

My name is Marcela, i'm 16 years old, and i live in Honduras. I'm about to finish 10th grade in a school of Tegucigalpa :) In my free time i volunteer in a serpentarium so i actually make my part in the community too! :D i also like to make poetry and music. I was born in Tegucigalpa on May 19th, 1998. Since a child i was very active, i loved school, playing and going to the boy scouts, i am a very good student at school and now that i am in high school it seems that my hard work is paying off, so much that the school offered me this participation in the Intercultural Exchange :)

My most desired dream has always been: Travel.

So a couple of months ago i began applying to go on an Intercultural Exchange by AFS to Italy. I will be in Italy 10 months with a Family that will be hosting me all year, The cost of this exchange is USD 8,600, my parents are supporting me but they are having difficulties to raise the money, so a friend told me about IndieGoGo and i decided to launch this campaign to help raise this money.

I really want to help my parents and i also want to make my part in this project, i have to work on this! :D 

your support will be very important for me because every donation would be such a great help and relief for us! also think you will be helping me to learn a new language and you will be able to say "I help your learning" and i'll be able to say "thanks to this people i'm here today".

What we need and what you get

I need USD 8,600 before September 5, and my family will be receiving it to start paying AFS for my exchange. 

That covers my round trip ticket, health insurance, transportation and school :)

In token of my appreciation I have some cool rewards for you! 

*Includes  shout out videos, poems made by me, Kind contributions, T-shirts and pictures of my trip! :D

If i don't reach the goal my family will keep receiving the money i raised because it is a contribution to the money provided by my parents! :)

The Impact

With your help and support I shall be able to learn a new language, to learn about another cultures and share my own culture! and to acquire the knowledge and experience that it takes to create a better world and more open-minded people. 

In today's world many teenagers are so close-minded, they live in a world where for them only their culture exists, so impulsing this campaign will help more teenagers see that the world is plenty of things to discover!

Many teenagers fortunately are getting introduced to this thing of exchanges and most of them take the opportunity (like me) to discover new places, new people, and new cultures, they even appreciate how Christmas is celebrated in different parts of the world!

So your contribution is very important not only for me, but for a lot of teenagers in my country, because if they see other teenagers having success and discovering the world, they will be motivated and enter to this complete new life style.

Other ways to help

1.You can ask your friends or family folks who you think could contribute by getting the word out and sharing or posting the link to my campaign on your FB pages/twitter/email/blog

2. you can write to marceruelas45@gmail.com and send me words of motivation :D <3 also pray for the success of my campaign :)

3. Use the Share Tools provided by IndieGoGo :)

4. THANK YOU!!! :D
story_txt: My storyHello! Ciao! Hola! :DMy name is Marcela, i'm 16 years old, and i live in Honduras. I'm about to finish 10th grade in a school of Tegucigalpa :) In my free time i volunteer in a serpentarium so i actually make my part in the community too! :D i also like to make poetry and music. I was born in Tegucigalpa on May 19th, 1998. Since a child i was very active, i loved school, playing and going to the boy scouts, i am a very good student at school and now that i am in high school it seems that my hard work is paying off, so much that the school offered me this participation in the Intercultural Exchange :)My most desired dream has always been: Travel.So a couple of months ago i began applying to go on an Intercultural Exchange by AFS to Italy. I will be in Italy 10 months with a Family that will be hosting me all year, The cost of this exchange is USD 8,600, my parents are supporting me but they are having difficulties to raise the money, so a friend told me about IndieGoGo and i decided to launch this campaign to help raise this money.I really want to help my parents and i also want to make my part in this project, i have to work on this! :D your support will be very important for me because every donation would be such a great help and relief for us! also think you will be helping me to learn a new language and you will be able to say "I help your learning" and i'll be able to say "thanks to this people i'm here today".What we need and what you getI need USD 8,600 before September 5, and my family will be receiving it to start paying AFS for my exchange. That covers my round trip ticket, health insurance, transportation and school :)In token of my appreciation I have some cool rewards for you! *Includes  shout out videos, poems made by me, Kind contributions, T-shirts and pictures of my trip! :DIf i don't reach the goal my family will keep receiving the money i raised because it is a contribution to the money provided by my parents! :)The ImpactWith your help and support I shall be able to learn a new language, to learn about another cultures and share my own culture! and to acquire the knowledge and experience that it takes to create a better world and more open-minded people. In today's world many teenagers are so close-minded, they live in a world where for them only their culture exists, so impulsing this campaign will help more teenagers see that the world is plenty of things to discover!Many teenagers fortunately are getting introduced to this thing of exchanges and most of them take the opportunity (like me) to discover new places, new people, and new cultures, they even appreciate how Christmas is celebrated in different parts of the world!So your contribution is very important not only for me, but for a lot of teenagers in my country, because if they see other teenagers having success and discovering the world, they will be motivated and enter to this complete new life style.Other ways to help1.You can ask your friends or family folks who you think could contribute by getting the word out and sharing or posting the link to my campaign on your FB pages/twitter/email/blog2. you can write to marceruelas45@gmail.com and send me words of motivation :D <3 also pray for the success of my campaign :)3. story:
I am sorry this is long but please read it guys. This isn't easy for me to say.

Some of you guys know this, but I have had a rough last few years. I obviously have some issues from combat like we all do but it got to the point where I was about to be homeless. At one point I was sitting on my couch with a gun to my head and the only thing that stopped me is my dogs picked up on it and started to lick me. My dogs brought me back just long enough to realize I had a responsibility to my wife, my brothers, my family, and to them and how jacked up it would be to check out and leave them to deal with the mess. My dogs saved my life. Things didn't get better though. I was still about to be homeless. Taking the gun away from my head didn't put money in my pocket. I could get work but not a steady job. I started selling everything I owned to pay my rent, my bills, and my child support. I sold everything I had to include my guns. I don't want to get too into details just to keep this from being a book, but the bottom line is I sold guns to the wrong person, and they shipped them to China. He eventually got caught, set me up in a sting trying to save his own ass and I went to federal prison for international arms trafficking. I plead out to 5 years but my judge saw that I was salvageable. He took my record into consideration, as well as the circumstances I was in and gave me two years. I just got out in February.

So this weekend I did this personal development course called Landmark Forum. Its a transformational program to help people get over their past and do what they want to do. I went into it thinking I could get some tips to help me get through school and into my career. A lot of stuff came out though.

This weekend a lot of the anger and guilt I carry with me came out and I stood up and told 120 of the other people in the class how much I hated them for thanking me for my service and how they are stupid sheep and don't have our back. I went into gory detail of one of the incidents where I saw one of my brothers blown apart in front of me. I blamed them for our brothers killing themselves for their lack of understanding and for letting the system get away with not helping the guys who need it. All this anger came out and I realized it was just my story, not what happened. I am attaching all these things to what happened. I was able to breakthrough all that stuff with the guy leading it. I am a new person, my wife was blown away last night when I got home, she has never seen me so happy. I committed myself to getting combat guys to come to the forum so they can have their own breakthroughs. I had no idea how I was going to make it happen considering its between $545 and $575 to come to the course but I knew I needed to get guys there.

A lot of people came up to me after I shared all this. People just started handing me money to pay for guys to come. Other people started handing me their business cards and said they would pay/sponsor any veteran to come to the course. The leader of the course said if I could organize a course for just combat vets he would come lead it on his time off. All this stuff just started falling into place.

I am not selling anything. This isn't some cult or religious organization. This isn't motivational seminars or brainwashing. Landmark works with fortune 500 companies and regular people around the country and around the world to help them transform their companies and their lives.

My life has transformed. I am not "fixed" but I now have the tools to cope and deal with my issues from combat, prison, and life. I am not going to just sit by and read/post pictures on Facebook of my brothers that are committing suicide, say 12/5, rest easy, RIP, Semper Fidelis and then do nothing. That makes me no better than the people who put the yellow ribbon magnets on their car and say they support the troops. I can't abide losing another brother to suicide. I can't abide seeing my brothers walking around with PTSD, anger, guilt, when I know this could help them. The status quo isn't working, the VA isn't working. I am willing to do anything to help all my brothers to get some peace and happiness.

I am begging you, with tears in my eyes, please contribute to this. You might just save someones life. I want to raise enough cash to send 10 combat veterans to the course.

story:
My Best Friend, Emily Bentley

Here are a few things you should know about her....

  • Emily lived and served with Anti-Human Trafficking Nonprofits and half-way houses in Cambodia
  • She serves as Vice-President of Students Against Human Trafficking at UNT
  • She fund raised for all of 2013 and traveled to volunteer with Kay Angel Orphan Home in Haiti (see our slideshow at http://youtu.be/SiiMk2bJ_5o)
  • She performed in UNT's Vagina Monologues, raising funds & awareness about domestic abuse and female empowerment
  • She served in a leadership role with UNT's Feminist Organization
  • She's currently working 30+ hours per week AND going to school full-time
  • She wants to be a midwife in a poverty-stricken country when she grows up
  • She has a huge heart, and there's no one else who deserves this more

She was carefully selected for the Global Leadership Through Service program in China

During 5 weeks in China, she will....

  • Participate in various service projects to aide Chinese villages, such as Jianchuan and Lijang
  • Collaborate with other students to serve minority groups in Yunnan province
  • Explore the unique cultures of southern China
  • Earn 6 credits through Global Leadership Through Service coursework by night toward her Bachelor's degree

But Money's Holding Her Back

There's a fee of $800 and $5,700 in program costs that she needs for this mission! Although Emily is working her tush off, I know that even this is too much for her to do alone. I am asking all friends, family members, humanitarians and those who want to be part of a success story to get involved. I can promise that by investing in Emily's future and in this mission, she will go forward to make a difference in the lives of many others, not only in China but all about the world. But she needs us to join forces with our dollars and help her get there. 

The Breakdown of Costs:

  • Study Abroad Faculty-Led Application Charge......300.00
  • Faculty-Led Program Deposit..............................500.00
  • Indiegogo Fees & Credit Card Charges.................75.00

Total.......................................................................... $875.00

***STRETCH GOAL ***** $6,000.00

Any additional backing amounts will assist in meeting her final goal of $6,000 in program expenses. That's $5,200.00 more than the original goal. I would lvoe to see Emily's face when she realizes people have shared so much love with her that her program costs are now covered 100%! 

Please visit the following website to learn more about the course Emily will be taking: https://studyabroad.admin.unt.edu/index.cfm?FuseAction=Programs.ViewProgram&Program_ID=12022

Please visit the program budget at the following page:

https://studyabroad.admin.unt.edu/index.cfm?FuseAction=Programs.BudgetSheet&Term=Summer&Program_ID=12022


If Emily Succeeds, We All Succeed

  • Your investment in Emily will serve many people in several villages throughout China.
  • Your contributions will further Emily's education with 6 credit hours (Education is Freedom!)
  • Previous projects we have carried out have been 100% successful, such as A New Year for Haitian Angels, Bird by Bird benefit, and Peabody's Burlesque Show for Kay Angel event (Just sayin').
  • How else could you better spend $875? 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know, money's tight... but here's what else you can do!

  • Share this campaign with friends via Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
  • Ask five friends for a dollar, then make a contribution!
  • Host a dinner to raise funds for the cause.
  • Hold an online raffle for your FB friends who contribute.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joe Rothstein and I am the founder of Turning Points Media, a company that develops educational materials for children, with a focus on speech and language skills. Our first product was Power Tunes, a multi-award winning educational children's album. Now, with your help, we can launch our next product, a 2-volume workbook to help children develop language skills. Volume 1 is for students ages 4-7 and includes a variety of play-based activities for naturalistic learning. Volume 2 is for students ages 8-11 and includes structured activities with more explicit instruction. This resource can benefit many children with special needs including autism, specific language impairment, and even children learning English as a second language.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is where the money will go (estimates):

  • $300 for editing
  • $600 for illustrations
  • $400 for graphic design
  • $500 for printing
  • $700 for other costs (copyright/trademark filing, marketing, etc.)
To show my gratitude for your support, I have created "thank you" gifts for each donation level. Even a personalized original song!

The Impact

  • 1 in 68 children has been identified with autism spectrum disorder.

  • Between 6 and 8 million people in the United States have some form of language impairment.

Your support will help bring a valuable resource to many children with special needs including autism, specific language impairment, and even children learning English as a second language.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to give a donation, that's okay! You can still help by spreading the word. Post a link on your Facebook account, Twitter, or in an email. Anything helps!

story:
Une petite introduction

Hi, I’m Asia Tallino, a fourth year student at UC Berkeley majoring in Food Systems and minoring in Global Poverty. I have had the most amazing privilege to make my own major and truly tailor my education here at Cal. Since I've been here, my mind has been blown uncountable times, but what has really resonated with me, and has become my passion & life-purpose, is food. Much more than just cooking and eating it, I've fixated on food systems and politics - how it's made, how it's distributed, how its consumed, and the 'who' in all of these questions - which has tied together smoothly with my major. Food is one of the most basic life necessities, and in my opinion, this means that every person should have access to it. After research for a literature review, I have come to recognize urban agriculture as an extremely effective method for not only providing food to a community, but also for providing jobs for more stable income generation in a community.

To pursue exploring this further, this summer, from June 17th-August 13th, I will be conducting independent research and working with urban farmers & members of Provania, a small farmers’ association aimed to economically support their urban farmers, in Pikine, Senegal. The purpose of this study is to research how current and possible waste-reuse strategies, such as composting, are managed and/or supported by farmers and municipal policies. Waste-reuse methods would improve the sustainability and self-efficiency of urban farms, which would help support the urban farmers' businesses and livelihoods.

What I Need & What You Get

To much of my excitement, I have received the UCB ‘Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship,’ which graciously covers about 80% of the costs for my trip and project. However in order for me to able to complete my research in entirety, while also supporting myself independently abroad, I am working to raise about $1500 more. With this money I will be able to travel (taxi and bus fares) around Pikine to conduct interviews, buy a digital audi recorder for the interviews and other documentation, pay for a temporary telephone while I am there, and rent a small piece of land and gather materials to build a composting demonstration site for the farmers, while also keeping myself well-sheltered and well-fed. 

As tokens of my appreciation for your contribution, there will be various gifts for you! For contributions of $10-$25, I will bring you back a small souvenir. For contributions of $25-$50+ I will give a video of my trip and experience abroad, and a small souvenir. For contributions of $50-$150+, on top of the $25-$50 gift, I will also mention your name in the 'Special Thanks To' section of my research write-up senior thesis. On top of both of these gifts, for contributions of $151-$250, I will personally cook you a dinner, wine included, for 1-3 people after my return; and for contributions of $251-$500+, a dinner for 4-6 people.

The Impact

As a contributor to this campaign, you will also be contributing to the movement to gain more knowledge and scholarly evidence on urban agriculture and its potential to alleviate poverty; whether that poverty is in Africa, or right here in California. On a more personal level, you will be enabling me to actually do what I'm profoundly interested in and have been working towards, so that I may begin to make a difference somewhere, somehow, doing what I love. For this, I will always be grateful of you. 

Urban Agriculture has been proclaimed around the world in the past few decades as a solution to several problems of poverty, such as lowering urban food security, improving health and nutritional statuses, especially in children and women, increasing employment opportunities and income generation, and being environmentally sustainable. As the majority of the populations in the world are projected to live in cities by 2030, urban agriculture is becoming more recognized for urban food supply and poverty alleviation.  However, in many places, such as Pikine, a city in the Dakar region of Senegal, urban farmers are struggling to find the economic support and land they need to continue and expand their production of perishable foods in and near urban areas. 

In Senegal, about one third of urban households live in poverty.  Pikine is the second largest city in Senegal with 1.2 million and is located in the Niayes Valley, a region of fertile soils prime for horticulture where a diversity of agricultural activities occur, namely vegetable, fruit, and floral cultivation, and fishing. There are about 1500 urban farmers performing market-oriented production. However, over the last 30 years, the area of land for agriculture has decreased by 80 percent in Pikine, mainly as urban development threatens land-use for urban agriculture. 

More sustainable practices and the inclusion of urban agriculture into urban planning and municipal policies on areas, such as land-use and waste management, could greatly improve the impact of urban farms on urban poverty, not to mention the lives of the 1500 farmers in Pikine. By recycling resources that would otherwise be urban waste and pollution, these strategies would provide farmers with alternative fertilizers (as opposed to off-farm chemical fertilizer inputs), saving them money while also being environmentally-friendly. Further, by helping to make their farms locally sustainable and self-efficient, the farmers will be able to work the land they have access to more intensely in order maintain and increase productivity as market-oriented farmers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a monetary contribution is not feasible for you, that's totally fine, and I thank you for your interest since you've read this far! Another way to help me is to simply spread the word about my campaign to your network of friends, family, and/or coworkers. Any support towards urban agriculture, whether it be here in the Bay Area or abroad somewhere else, will also make me very happy. Thank you!

market-oriented production. However, over the last 30 years, the area of land for agriculture has
decreased by 80 percent in Pikine, mainly as urban development threatens
land-use for urban agriculture. More sustainable practices and the inclusion of urban agriculture into urban planning and municipal policies on areas, such as land-use and waste management, could greatly improve the impact of urban farms on urban poverty, not to mention the lives of the 1500 farmers in Pikine. By recycling
resources that would otherwise be urban waste and pollution, these strategies
would provide farmers with alternative fertilizers (as opposed to off-farm
chemical fertilizer inputs), saving them money while also being
environmentally-friendly. Further, by helping to make their farms locally
sustainable and self-efficient, the farmers will be able to work the land they
have access to more intensely in order maintain and increase productivity as
market-oriented farmers.Other Ways You Can HelpIf a monetary contribution is not feasible for you, that's totally fine, and I thank you for your interest since you've read this far! Another way to help me is to simply spread the word about my campaign to your network of friends, family, and/or coworkers. Any support towards urban agriculture, whether it be here in the Bay Area or abroad somewhere else, will also make me very happy. Thank you!

story:
INSIEME A SUON DI MUSICA PER LA SCUOLA CHE VORREI

For English version, scroll down please!

Ciao, mi chiamo Dharma Cristiano Botti e sono il creatore di Onebeat (www.onebeat.it), attività per l’espansione del potenziale umano tramite il ritmo in ambito scolastico, aziendale e ricreatvo.

Con la metodologia del Drum Circle (cerchio di percussioni) e di altre attività complementari creiamo una dimensione in cui nuovi aspetti di sé possano essere rivelati tramite il potere del ritmo, in un'atmosfera in cui i cuori pulsano e suonano all'unisono, favorendo la sensibilizzazione di principi fondamentali come empatia, amicizia, creatività ed armonia d'insieme.

Mentre i partecipanti si divertono nel creare una vera e propria orchestra ritmica, li aiutiamo a riconoscere ed apprezzare se stessi e lo spirito di gruppo, imparando così ad essere creativi insieme e per il bene di ognuno. Questo è il piccolo contributo che amiamo donare al mondo.

IL NOSTRO PROGETTO
Dopo il successo avuto dall'amico Harshil Filippo Chiostri con 'Tamburi per l'amicizia', Onebeat intende realizzare, con il tuo aiuto, un progetto da € 3.500 che ci aiuti a portare i benefici del Drum circle facilitato in ambito scolastico, senza dover dipendere dai quasi inesistenti fondi statali.

Il nostro obiettivo è quello di facilitare un percorso ritmico di 10 incontri per classe con un numero di 80 studenti in una o più scuole della Toscana, dimostrando che è possibile ricreare profonde occasioni per:
  • l'avvicinamento a se stessi e alle proprie qualità;
  • stimolare l'amicizia e la collaborazione fra gli studenti;
  • l'allontanamento da stili di vita distruttivi;
  • l'aumento delle capacità di apprendimento mentale ed intelligenza emotiva.

PERCHE' UNA RACCOLTA FONDI?
Perché la scuola, nonostante abbia sempre mostrato interesse alla nostra proposta, ha pochi soldi da investire in progetti di questo tipo, mentre noi abbiamo un'immensa voglia di offrire ai ragazzi questa opportunità di scoprire un nuovo modo di vedere le cose tramite un mezzo creativo e divertente.
Un modo diverso di vedere se stessi e di relazionarsi agli altri è possibile se vengono offerte le giuste chiavi di comprensione, a dispetto del senso di separazione ed isolamento che si insinuano sempre più ferocemente nei giovani a causa della mancanza di valori e fiducia.

Sogno un pianeta basato sulla cooperazione per il bene di tutti, piuttosto che sulla competizione e l'egoismo. Creare una dimensione in cui questo viene riconosciuto in un'età adolescienziale significa porre le basi per una società basata sull'amicizia e il benessere.


IL PERCHE' DEL RITMO
La magia del ritmo e del suono passa attraverso qualsiasi barriera di età, sesso, religione, ideale, provenienza e cultura. Il risultato è che si dissolvono le apparenti separazioni, ritrovandoci a sorridere, ridere e creare musica coinvolgente assieme, in un'atmosfera gioiosa ed ideale per discutere e riconoscere valori cari all'armonia individuale e di gruppo.
Personalmente amo il mio lavoro perché è soprendente ed unico vedere come il potere del suono ci riporti ad una naturale condizione di gioia ed unione oltre le apparenti differenze, riscoprendo una visione di sé e degli altri più consapevole ed amorevole.

Con il Drum Circle facilitato portiamo un’iniezione di amicizia, intelligenza emozionale e vitalità nel mondo dei ragazzi, grazie al consolidato valore di questo metodo testato e dimostrato anche da alcune comunità scientifiche. (Il valore terapeutico dei tamburi & Impatto sul genoma e sistema immunitario)
Nel processo di formazione di un'orchestra ritmica, le diversità diventano opportunità e risorse, piuttosto che elementi da temere.
Inoltre esploriamo e sviluppiamo le nostre capacità espressive, comunicative e creative, raggiungendo importanti obiettivi sul piano individuale e relazionale. In particolare:

  • Imparare a sentire il ritmo.
  • Favorire il rilassamento e lo sblocco delle tensioni psicofisiche ed emotive.
  • Esplorare e sviluppare la propria capacità di espressione individuale superando la timidezza e la paura del giudizio.
  • Comprendere le regole di base in modo da costruire un gruppo coeso dove ognuno, in base al proprio livello e al proprio potenziale, possa trovare il giusto spazio nel rispetto di sé e degli altri. Sensibilizzare le capacità di ascolto, la comunicazione e lo scambio interculturale.
  • Usare il tramite ritmico e il tamburo come veicolo di espressione di emozioni e vissuti, in un'atmosfera giocosa, di accettazione e sicura.
  • Aprire e sviluppare le qualità creative.
  • Afferrare la magia del ritmo e del cerchio.

COME PUOI AIUTARCI
Abbiamo bisogno di raccogliere €3.500 per coprire i costi del progetto.

Per questo ci rivolgiamo ai nostri sostenitori, come te, invitandoti a condividere con i tuoi amici e parenti il nostro progetto, in modo da contribuire assieme nella creazione di questa nuova opportunità per una società più armonica e rispettosa dell’essere umano.
Non solo ci aiuterai a risvegliare lo spirito di collaborazione ed amicizia fra i ragazzi,  ma ci permetterai anche di far conoscere il progetto e diffonderlo in tutta Italia.
Se raccoglieremo più fondi di quelli richiesti, cercheremo di allargare  il progetto a più ragazzi e a più scuole, puntando a farlo diventare un modello educativo integrato nel percorso scolastico.
In cambio del tuo aiuto ti offriremo - oltre ai ringraziamenti -  diversi tipi di ricompensa,  come puoi  colonna a destra e più giù in questa pagina.
Grazie...e mi raccomando, contiamo sul tuo contributo, clicca su una delle opzioni e condividi il nostro progetto!


COME USEREMO LE DONAZIONI
I soldi che ci donerai verranno usati per pagare i costi del progetto, cioè:

  • le ore di lavoro del facilitatore;
  • disponibilità di oltre 40 strumenti fra tamburi e percussioni;
  • i costi di viaggio e trasporto;
  • supporto alla logistica del progetto;
  • materiale didattico per gli studenti;
  • produzione di documenti, filmati e foto del progetto in azione, che poi condivideremo con te;
  • eventuale copertura per riparazione/sostituzione strumenti per danni durante l’uso.

Nel caso non raggiungessimo il budget richiesto, modelleremo il percorso nelle scuole in base all'ammontare di denaro raccolto.


ENGLISH VERSION


TOGETHER IN MUSIC FOR THE SCHOOL I WISH

Hello, my name is Dharma Cristiano Botti and I am the founder of Onebeat (www.onebeat.it) an italian project for the expansion of human potential through rhythm.

Through Drum Circle and other complementary activities we create an environment in which we can discover new aspects of ourselves through the power of rhythm and sound, in an atmosphere that brings one another closer together, developing important qualities such as friendship, empathy, creativity and gruop harmony.

While participants have fun in creating a real rhythmical orchestra, we help them to recognize and appreciate themselves and team spirit, remembering how creative they can be together for the good of everyone. This is our small gift we love sharing to the world!


OUR PROJECT:
After the success of my friend Harshil Filippo Chiostri with 'Drums for friendship', our intention is to achieve, with your help, a project needing € 3.500, which will help us to bring the benefits of drum circle at school, without having to depend on almost non-existent state funds.
Our goal is to facilitate a rhythmic educational path of 10 meetings per class for a number of 80 students in Tuscany, which demonstrates that it is possible to create opportunities for deep promotion for:

  • a closer approach to themselves and their inner qualities;
  • a better cooperation and friendship amongst students;
  • a moving away from destructive lifestyles;
  • increased learning capacity, not only mental, but also of  emotional intelligence.

WHY A FUNDRAISER?
Because school has no money to invest in this kind of projects, while we have a huge desire to offer this opportunity for a new way to see things through a funny and creative activity.
A new way to see oneself and others is possible if the right keys of understanding are bound to be offered, in spite of the sense of separation and isolation which are creeping more and more amongst youths, due to the lack of values and trust.
I dream a planet which is based on cooperation for the good of everyone, rather than competition and selfishness. Creating an environment in which this can be recognized and appreciated in early age means to put the foundation for a new society based on friendship and wellness.


WHY RHYTHM AND MUSIC?
The magic of the rythym and music overcomes all barriers of age, gender, religion, ideals and culture. The result is, that all apparent separation dissolves, and we find ourselves smiling, laughing and creating beautiful engaging music together!
Personally, I love my job because it is amazing and unique to see how the power of rhythm and sound brings again ourselves to our natural state of joy and unity beyond apparent diversity. Thanks to this, we rediscover a more aware and loving vision of oneself and others.

With facilitated Drum Circle we bring an injection of friendship , emotional intelligence and collaborative vitality in the world of youth, thanks to the well-established value of this method.
During the formation of "ensemble consciousness" of the orchestra, differences become opportunities and resources, rather than elements to fear. In the project we explore and develop our communicative, expressive and creative abilities, reaching important objectives both on an individual basis and when relating to others. In particular:

  • Learning to feel the rythym.
  • Encouraging relaxation and facilitating the unlocking of emotional and psychophysical tensions.
  • Exploring and developing our capability of individual expression, overcoming shyness and fear of judgement.
  • Understanding and implementing basic rules in order to build a united group, in which they can then develop a sense of respect for themselves and the others within the group.
  • Developing listening and communication skills and cultural exchanges between students.
  • Use of the drum and rythym as a tool to express emotions and experiences within an open, accepting and playful atmosphere.
  • Opening and developing creative qualities.
  • Catching the magic of rythym and the circle.

HOW YOU CAN HELP!
We need to raise € 3,500 to cover the costs of the project.
For this we turn to our supporters, like you, and we ask you please to share it with your friends and family  so that together we can help to create new opportunities for a more harmonious society and respectful of the human being.
You will help us to awaken the spirit of cooperation and friendship amongst the young , but also lets us to make the project visible and then spread throughout Italy.
If we collect more funds than required, we will expand the project to more youth, to more schools , aiming to turn it into an educational model, integrated into the school curriculum!
In return for your help we offer - in addition to the thanks - different types of reward, as you can see in the column to the right and further down on this page.
I entrust you, please give us a hand, click on one of the options and share our project!  Thank you!

HOW WE WILL USE YOUR DONATION
Your funds will be used to pay the costs of the project, namely:

  • Facilitator’s hours of work.
  • Availability of more than 40 between drums and percussion.
  • Costs of travel and transport.
  • Logistics support of the project.
  • Educational training materials for students.
  • Production of documents, movie and photos of the project in action: then we will share it with you.
  • Coverage for repair or replacement to damaged drums during use.

If we will not reach the entire amount requested for the project, we will redistribute what will have been collected in order to resize the intervention but still take it to school as much as possible. At the end of collection we will be able to determine the size of the intervention.

story:
What is HOBY WA?

In short, we change lives.

Hugh O'Brian Youth Leadership  of Washington has been offering transformative leadership development programs to high school sophomores throughout the state since 1980.  Our efforts have changed the lives of more than 5000 young leaders, inspiring them to take action toward positive change in their communities!    

HOBY Washington offers leadership opportunities for youth and adults alike. As a state affiliate of HOBY International, our all-volunteer team in Washington State works year-long to support the annual HOBY Washington Leadership Seminar in the spring and the ongoing HOBY Alumni activities to support alumni development after the seminar.

How Can You Help?

Each year, it costs HOBY WA, a 501c3 nonprofit, more than $20,000 to transform the lives of 130 young people, but we do not charge individual students to attend.  Most of our funding comes from the schools and communities of those who attend, alumni, and from volunteers who pound the pavement to secure corporate and small business sponsors.

In order to keep make this life-changing experience possible, though, we need people like you to help!

If you can spare even $1, it will go a long way in helping HOBY WA put on a powerful, transformative seminar for the youth of Washington State.

Every person who donates can take advantage of one our fine Thank You gifts, and raffles will be offered throughout the campaign for awesome prizes!

How will your donation help our communities?

Each year, close to 130 high school sophomore leaders from around the state of Washington come together for a life-changing experience.  These young leaders spend four days learning and collaborating toward a brighter future for the state of Washington and our nation by participating in leadership development exercises, listening to powerful guest speakers, volunteering in the community, and building life-long relationships. 

At the end of the seminar, each leader commits herself or himself to completing at least 100 hours of community service to pass on their HOBY experience to their community.  High School ambassadors go on to complete service in their schools, their churches, and in their wider community, often collaborating with service clubs like Lions and Kiwanis to further extend their impact.  Because of the experience they had at the HOBY Seminar, Ambassadors have contributed an estimated 210,000 hours of community service to their communities throughout the state of Washington.

In short, you are investing in the future of our communities by investing in young leaders who will be given the tools to transform their world through servant leadership.

Don't have any cash?  Consider Volunteering!

Volunteers are truly the engine of HOBY WA.  Considering that we don't have a single paid staff member, we're always looking for new folks to help!

We are looking for dedicated volunteers who are 21 years or older to serve as Facilitators for the inspiring Ambassador experience.  Click Here to fill out a volunteer application with HOBY International, and we will be contacted to approve your application!

-------------------

Hugh O'Brian Youth Leadership is a 501(c)(3) charitable organization.
HOBY Washington's Affiliate Tax ID# is 91-1686238.

Each year, close to 130 high school sophomore leaders from around the state of Washington come together for a life-changing experience.  These young leaders spend four days learning and collaborating toward a brighter future for the state of Washington and our nation by participating in leadership development exercises, listening to powerful guest speakers, volunteering in the community, and building life-long relationships. 
At the end of the seminar, each leader commits herself or himself to completing at least 100 hours of community service to pass on their HOBY experience to their community.  High School ambassadors go on to complete service in their schools, their churches, and in their wider community, often collaborating with service clubs like Lions and Kiwanis to further extend their impact.  Because of the experience they had at the HOBY Seminar, Ambassadors have contributed an estimated 210,000 hours of community service to their communities throughout the state of Washington.
In short, you are investing in the future of our communities by investing in young leaders who will be given the tools to transform their world through servant leadership.


Don't have any cash?  Consider Volunteering!
Volunteers are truly the engine of HOBY WA.  Considering that we don't have a single paid staff member, we're always looking for new folks to help!
We are looking for dedicated volunteers who are 21 years or older to serve as Facilitators for the inspiring Ambassador experience.  Click Here to fill out a volunteer application with HOBY International, and we will be contacted to approve your application!
-------------------
Hugh O'Brian Youth Leadership is a 501(c)(3) charitable organization.HOBY Washington's Affiliate Tax ID# is 91-1686238.

story:
A Little About Me

Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Jules Tankel. I'm a member of the downtown Fort Wayne community, a part-time non-profit employee, a percussionist, a loving dog owner, and most recently in my life, I'm a professional hula hooper. I started my hoop journey around August of 2011 when I bought my first Hula Hoops from a neighbor’s garage sale (Thanks Pepper!). I immediately insisted that my friend Max learn with me. By the time September rolled around, we were hooked. In the winter of 2012, I purchased my fire hoop. This was around the same time that a few of my friends started spinning fire, and we got together with some people who had already played with fire before. After a few months, we started a fire and LED performance troupe, called Pyroscope Entertainment. Hooping is just one of many Flow Arts, and my fire family inspires me to keep working hard and honing my skills to become the best fire artist I can be. After our first paying gig, I had a moment of clarity. Never in my life would I ever had guessed that one day, I would be a professional fire performer. Since we started doing public performances around our community, I’ve had people approach me, wanting to learn to art of hoop dance. I have not taught official classes on hoop dance or hoop fitness, because I want to have the best resources available to make the most out of any potential student’s experience. I am ready to take the next step and begin my teacher training, but I cannot afford the daunting cost of certification and liability insurance. This is where you can help, and we can help each other!

What I Need & What You Get

What I need from to make this happen is I need to pre-sell enough hoop classes so that I can pay for my teacher training. I’m also accepting donations, and gifts-in-kind. All pre-sold classes will be 20% off the normal class price! What you will be getting by purchasing a class or class pack now is a Gift Certificate redeemable for one hour classes once my teacher training has been completed. I’m offering certificates for single classes, and 8-packs of classes (8 classes for the price of 7!). Where and when will these classes be held? It’s hard to say a definitive time or place prior to the completion of my certification and my insurance. However, I do have a few locations already on board. My goal is to have my classes at a few different locations around the Fort Wayne area to reach out as many people as possible. As for Days/Times, Most classes will be held on Tuesdays and Thursdays during the day, but I will offer night classes and weekend classes if there is interest. If you are not able to come to Fort Wayne for classes, please e-mail me (julia.tankel@gmail.com) and see if we can work out a time or place that works for you. These classes, unless otherwise noted, are for the Fort Wayne, Indiana area. 

  • $12- Single Class Certificate (Normal Price, $15)
  • $24- One Hour Private Lesson (Normal Price, $30)
  • $84- 8-Pack of Classes (Normal Price, $105)

I will also accept donations and gifts in kind. Any amount puts me one step closer to achieving my dream of becoming a licensed and insured hula hoop instructor!

Where is the money going?

So everyone knows exactly where the money is going, and what for, I am giving you a breakdown.

$599- Hoopnotica Method Level 1 Distance Teacher Training (good for two years)

$268- K and K Liability Insurance (good for two years)

$68- Indiegogo Fees (4% fee on money raised, plus additional processing fees, aka the price of doing business)

I only get the money if I raise the total amount by my projected date, 45 day after launch. If I don't, then there is no risk to you. It was important to me that I raise the money in such a way where if I didn't succeed, you wouldn't be penalized. 

Why Hula Hooping?

I want to raise awareness of how hula hooping can change your life. I am so grateful for everything hooping has done for me, and I want others to experience the same joy I do. It promotes healthy living, and it’s great for the body and the mind. I want to give the gift of hooping to our community!

I loved everything about hooping. I love the feeling of the hoop twirling around me. I love the bruises and “battle wounds” that come from spending countless hours perfecting a trick. I love that moment where everything else seems to fade away, and the only two things left in the world are you and your hoop. Most of all, I love how powerful, how healthy, and how strong I’ve become because of hula hooping. 

Here are a few articles on the benefits of hooping

http://www.amoils.com/health-blog/10-really-good-reasons-to-take-up-the-revitalized-hula-hoop/

http://www.hooping.org/2013/01/michelle-obama-hula-hoops-with-chica-the-chicken/

http://www.health.com/health/gallery/0,,20397949,00.html

 

My Health Struggle, and How Hooping Helped

I want everyone to feel as empowered and confident as I do in my hoop. Hula hooping saved my life. Yes, I hear how corny that sounds, but I really feel that in my case it’s true. I have a digestive condition, more specifically; I have a misshapen lower intestine. It’s a chronic condition that’s exacerbated by large amounts of stress, low-fiber diet, and lack of exercise. It causes me to have an extremely lowered appetite, lowered metabolism, and severe pains after eating. The only real options for me were to take fiber, eat healthier, and stay active. I started losing weight rapidly. At my lowest weight, I was 94 pounds. I felt weak and dizzy all the time. Then I started hula hooping. After just a few weeks, I had an appetite again. The new exercise boosted my metabolism, and I started gaining weight. The weight I gained back was healthy weight, muscle weight. Every day I grew stronger, and I continue to grow stronger still. Once I had been hooping for a month or so, I was back to a normal weight, but I was healthier than I had ever been before. For the first time in my life, I feel like I have complete command over my body. I am capable of anything now. I never would have described myself as an active or a fit person, never would I ever had guessed I’d be doing any sort of exercise for fun. Let alone on a daily basis. I hoop because I love everything about it. Now I want to share it with the world!

story:
About the book

This book will teach you the core concepts of neural networks and deep learning.  These are powerful machine learning techniques which have achieved outstanding results for problems in image recognition, speech recognition, and natural language processing.  Neural networks and deep learning are now being adopted by many companies, including Google, Microsoft, and Facebook.

I'm writing this book to bridge the gap between popular accounts and the many technical papers on neural networks and deep learning. The book will make it easy and fun for people with programming and basic mathematical skills to come up to speed.

I love explaining complex technical subjects.  I've written two previous books.  The first book, "Quantum Computation and Quantum Information" (joint with Ike Chuang), is the standard text on quantum computing, and one of the ten most cited books in the history of physics. The second book, "Reinventing Discovery: The New Era of Networked Science", is a book for a general audience about networked science.  It was named one of the best books of 2011 by The Financial Times  and the Boston Globe.  

In addition to my books I've written many technical articles, including "Lisp as the Maxwell's equations of software", "How to crawl a quarter billion webpages in 40 hours", and "Why Bloom filters work the way they do", all of which made the top five posts on Hacker News.

You can see a draft of chapter 1 of the book at neuralnetworksanddeeplearning.com.

The book will be made freely available online, under a Creative Commons Attribution-Non-Commercial license.

As an independent writer and scientist, the reason I'm undertaking this Indiegogo campaign is to give me some partial support while I complete the book. 

Draft table of contents

  • Using neural nets to recognize handwritten digits: We get off to a flying start, creating a neural network that can solve a hard problem - recognizing handwritten digits.
  • Using backpropagation to speed up learning: We'll master the ins-and-outs of the backpropagation algorithm, which is the fundamental algorithm used to learn in neural nets, and the basis for deep learning.
  • Neural nets: the big picture:  How do artificial neural nets compare to biological brains? Is there a simple universal algorithm for thinking? How can we use neural nets to solve problems in speech recognition and natural language processing? Can we use neural nets to compute an arbitrary function?
  • Deep learning: What makes deep neural networks hard to train with conventional approaches?  How can we overcome those challenges? We'll see how deep neural nets can be pre-trained, and how they can learn high-level representations of knowledge from complex data.
  • Recent progress in image recognition: We'll dive into exciting recent work using deep learning to solve difficult problems in image recognition, including recognizing the images in ImageNet, and the Stanford-Google "cat neuron" paper.
  • The future of neural nets: Will neural nets help lead to artificial intelligence?  Can they be used to simulate a human brain?
