story:
Forsa Afrika's goal is to help fund the Cape Verde Rugby Union

My name is Mareika McLaughlin and I've been living in the Cape Verdean Islands since 2007.  I started the Cape Verde Rugby Union completely by accident in 2010.  It's snowballed out of control with a rabid participation to the point where young men are stopping me on the street and asking how they can participate.  We don't just teach rugby.  We use rugby as a catalyst for development.  We are not just creating athletes.  We are creating sportsmen, community leaders, positive role models for younger boys and a force for good in each community where we have a presence.  

Once we have community leaders in place we can use these teams to accomplish anything we want.  We have organized community development projects and cultural activities with these teams.  We keep track of the grades of all players still in high school.  The player with the best grades and the grades which have improved the most get their next year of high school paid for.  These younger players view the older players not just as role models but as heros or idols.  I want to use that influence to make the largest possible positive impact I can in each community.

What We Need is More Financing

The Cape Verde Rugby Union is sponsored by Cavibel.  This is the local Coca Cola bottling plant here in Cape Verde.  They have the capacity to cover the ground operational expenses, but as the project grows, so do the dreams and aspirations.

I've been encouraged by the African Confederation of Rugby to apply for participation.  We are actually the first Portuguese speaking African country to play rugby.  The International Rugby Board has already sent the regional training coordinator to do Rugby Ready training with us and evaluate the program.  He gave us a very positive review.  However we get no support from the government so I need to raise funds myself to send a national selection informally to Senegal for our first international experience.

The other opportunity I have is to send the best player from each adult team to play for a year in Portugal.  A very competitive, division 1 team in Arcos de Valdavez, Portugal has expressed interest in scouting our players.  The are situated right next to a professional training school called Epralima where the players could potentially do a professional training course at the same time.  This would also give them the opportunity to get referee and coaching training.

 

$1,000 donation gives you a 5 night stay at the Casa Strela in Tarrafal and the opportunity to participate in our end of the year Tarrafal Beach Rugby Tournament.

For those very generous donations of $1,000.  You will receive a 5 night stay at the Casa Strela Bed and Breakfast run by our very own Tarrafal rugby coach.  We can enter you on one of the teams participating in the tournament if you are an individual.  If you would like to come with your own team (beach rugby is 5 players per side) we can enter your own team into the tournament.  (Keep in mind free accommodations are only for each individual who donates 1,000 USD and airfare is not included in the offer.)

For those individuals who donate 500 USD we will send you a framed photo of one of our local teams, signed by the members of the team.
For those individuals who donate 100 USD we will send you a back pack from our local sponsor Cavibel.  A 50 dollar donations gets you a t-shirt, a 20 dollar donation a postcard of one of our teams, and a 10 dollar donation gets you a personalized shout out thank you on your facebook page.  

The Impact of the Cape Verde Rugby Union

I wish I could explain in words or in pictures the impact that these teams have in their communities.  It's not just the players who are effected positively.  Drug addiction, alcoholism and violence brought on by poverty are the unpleasant realities of many communities here in Cape Verde.  I might not be giving these players jobs through this project but what I do give them is motivation.....motivation to not do drugs, to not drink and to not steal.  Through participation in this project I have watched entire communities which were previously riddled with delinquency change for the better.  The mothers, sisters and wives of these players are so happy to see them participating in something positive.  The more they train the more the want to train.  Then they start training younger boys and children and becoming positive role models, good examples and community leaders for positive, healthy change.  

The International Rugby Board has taken notice of what we are doing, as well as various UK based charities that use rugby as a tool for development in a similar way.  We've received three international teams here in Cape Verde as well as the Regional Training Coordinating of the IRB for Africa.  This project started by accident and I never expected to be doing this, but it has become the project of my life.  I have seen few projects take off with the same velocity as this one.  The more we accomplish the bigger the dream gets and the more I want to accomplish.  I want to maximize my individual impact in a positive way in Cape Verde by creating a sustainable project that one day I can walk away from and know it will continue running itself.  It's a long road still to get there but I know we can do it because of the motivation of the participants.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money to donate we understand.  You can still help by spreading the word about the campaign.  If you are a rugby player we can always use equipment donations.  Feel free to message us on our facebook page and see how you can donate new or used equipment to the Cape Verde Rugby Union.

https://www.facebook.com/CapeVerdeRugbyUnion

story:
Real shelter for real people

According to the UN, 45 million people around the world have been displaced from their homes due to natural disaster or armed conflicts. The World Health Organization has officially acknowledged that women are disproportionately affected by disasters: they are more likely to die, suffer from violence, and not get the adequate care they need to rebuild their lives.

I witnessed this in my own country during the devastation of Hurricane Katrina in 2005. After three days of watching people crowd into the inhumane conditions of the New Orleans Superdome and Houston Astrodome (where families were separated from each other) I felt a call to action. I never thought that a styrofoam coffee cup would inspire the solution.



But this cup was the perfect inspiration for a portable, secure, stackable shelter. I initially started building my rapid response emergency housing system in my backyard. The result of many years of design and prototyping is the Exo housing unit, unparalleled in the world of disaster relief solutions. The Exo is a low-cost, durable, transportable and easy-to-assemble solution that can bring safety and security to suffering families.

I never intended for this to be a business, in fact I spent years trying to give the design away to government agencies and NGOs, but these organizations need private companies to develop products like these for them to use. Over the years, I have received so many requests from people around the world clamoring for this product, I decided to build Reaction - a company committed to revolutionizing the way the world responds to disasters.

I've gathered a superhero team of designers and engineers obsessed by creating remarkable experience to solve challenging problems. Previously, our team has:

  • Been an integral part of Disney magic band design and development team

  • Designed homeland security structures certified and approved by the Department of Defense and NYPD

  • Built a wireless mesh platform to connect consumer devices used for elderly assisted living 

We’ve raised venture capital investment to set up operations. Now we want to bring our products to the masses. Realizing that we couldn’t possibly understand the needs of a displaced family from the confines of our studio, our team wants to get our Exo prototypes out of our workshop and into the lives of people who really need them. Through rapid prototyping and iteration, we’ll tweak the design so it can best meet the community’s needs.

To do this, Reaction will partner with aid organizations around the world to deliver the Exo Housing System to families in need of shelter. The first pilots will be with select NGO's working with internally displaced persons in Syria and continued earthquake relief in Haiti.

The Maram Foundation was born of a desire to bring assistance to civilians blocked at the Syrian borders with neighboring countries after fleeing the violence that is devastating the country. Maram operates in Syria in a number of capacities:

  • managing a refugee camp
  • supporting field hospitals
  • organizing schools
  • providing facilities for aid workers


Aid by design

Your donations will go towards the construction and delivery of Exo prototypes to families in need. These 80 sq-ft units can temporarily house a family of four, offering them shelter and safety until suitable long-term housing can be built.

Unlike the infamous FEMA trailers that cost around $20,000 for a one time use, Exos can cost as little as 1/4 as much and can be set up in two minutes by hand, with no need for tools or heavy machinery.

They’re reusable, durable and safe - thanks to these features:

  • Energy efficient doors and skylights for ample natural lighting

  • Digital door locks to keep housing secure and safe for women and children.

  • Aircraft-grade aluminum

  • Rugged composite skins

  • Insulated for climate control

  • Capable of connecting to electricity, heat and air conditioning


Reaction is more than just individual units. In the aftermath of these disasters, mothers and children can be easily separated and whole familiescan be divided. After Hurricane Katrina, many of us remember the images of fathers and mothers roaming the Superdome and Astrodome with cardboard signs looking for their families. With this in mind, because of its size and transportability, we have designed Exos to be deployed in small pods, like a safe neighborhood or a familiar community.



Exos are wired for electricity and connectivity - so the units can be lit at night and parents can charge mobile phones to remain in touch within the family and with the broader community. The Exo units themselves form a wireless mesh network, recognizing the units around them and connecting to a single digital platform. Through one dashboard, aid organizations can monitor entire fleets of Exos to see which units are online, offline or in transit, while also monitoring for temperature or fire.

Join the movement

Women are often excluded from having a say in restoration and reconstruction efforts after disasters. In the process of providing housing for these families, we want them to inform how the product is designed in order to meet their needs in the future.  

When we deliver Exo Beta units, our team will work with the aid organizations deploying them and engage with the families using the shelters, so we can better understand their unique needs and design explicitly for them. Through rapid-iteration, we’ll incorporate this feedback for the next generation of products to provide shelter to millions in the years to come.

For every $10,000 we raise we will ship a housing unit to an additional family in need around the world. We have set a humble initial goal of $50,000 to house five families at no cost to the families or aid organizations working with them. 

Selected Perks

All contributing participants at all levels will receive an exclusive login to our Disaster Response portal, where they will be able to track the delivery of Exo housing units throughout the world as part of this campaign and other partnerships with global aid organizations.


Reaction Exo T-shirt

Reaction Disaster Response Team T-shirts (3 Designs):


3D Printed Exo (3 color options)


An Exo for you or a family in need (standard configuration)

Thank you...

Thanks for supporting a company that believes that thoughtful design can address resource challenges and provide a safe place for families after disaster. Help us tackle the problem of 32.5 million new people every year in need of rapid emergency response housing.
story_txt:
Real shelter for real peopleAccording to the UN, 45 million people around the world have been displaced from their homes due to natural disaster or armed conflicts. The World Health Organization has officially acknowledged that women are disproportionately affected by disasters: they are more likely to die, suffer from violence, and not get the adequate care they need to rebuild their lives.I witnessed this in my own country during the devastation of Hurricane Katrina in 2005. After three days of watching people crowd into the inhumane conditions of the New Orleans Superdome and Houston Astrodome (where families were separated from each other) I felt a call to action. I never thought that a styrofoam coffee cup would inspire the solution.But this cup was the perfect inspiration for a portable, secure, stackable shelter. I initially started building my rapid response emergency housing system in my backyard. The result of many years of design and prototyping is the Exo housing unit, unparalleled in the world of disaster relief solutions. The Exo is a low-cost, durable, transportable and easy-to-assemble solution that can bring safety and security to suffering families.I never intended for this to be a business, in fact I spent years trying to give the design away to government agencies and NGOs, but these organizations need private companies to develop products like these for them to use. Over the years, I have received so many requests from people around the world clamoring for this product, I decided to build Reaction - a company committed to revolutionizing the way the world responds to disasters.I've gathered a superhero team of designers and engineers obsessed by creating remarkable experience to solve challenging problems. Previously, our team has:
Been an integral part of Disney magic band design and development team
Designed homeland security structures certified and approved by the Department of Defense and NYPD
Built a wireless mesh platform to connect consumer devices used for elderly assisted living 
We’ve raised venture capital investment to set up operations. Now we want to bring our products to the masses. Realizing that we couldn’t possibly understand the needs of a displaced family from the confines of our studio, our team wants to get our Exo prototypes out of our workshop and into the lives of people who really need them. Through rapid prototyping and iteration, we’ll tweak the design so it can best meet the community’s needs.To do this, Reaction will partner with aid organizations around the world to deliver the Exo Housing System to families in need of shelter. The first pilots will be with select NGO's working with internally displaced persons in Syria and continued earthquake relief in Haiti.

story:
Why this project? What are we doing?

I was not supposed to be here. Haitian society determines how far young people from the masses like myself can go. I have hacked the system. I have overcome poverty, hunger, and humiliation to be where I am today. 

As for myself and most young Haitians from the masses, when leaving high school, college isn't an open door for us. With no access to college or jobs and no hope, young people have no clue what is waiting for them. When facing extreme hunger and extreme desperation a lot of them take refuge in drugs, gangs, prostitution and other form of corruption.

To solve this problem, IMPACT will provide financial literacy and entrepreneurship education in addition to the curriculum of two disadvantaged high schools where having a library, good books, good teachers, and computers is still a fantasy. The goal is to reach 100 enthusiastic students with workshops, including Introduction to Entrepreneurship, Budgeting & Saving and Communication & Networking. From this training they acquire the necessary tools to start a small economic activity and networking to find a mentor. The project will commence in two sister cities, Kenscoff and Pétion-Ville, located in western Haiti. 

What if you were going to school without knowing how your life will turn out? No hope. No future. What if your son or your daughter or your best friend believed he or she was destined to be poor? What if you had to walk 1-2 hours, hungry almost every day just to get to school? Would you not want school to pay off? This is what IMPACT is all about.

The solution to poverty is more than money or food. It’s a can-do mindset. We cannot keep feeding the poverty industry by creating future generations of poor people.  



What We Need & What You Get

To implement and run the year-long project the team needs $6000. The funding will enable us to create and print teaching materials, and buy projectors and computers. It will also help our volunteers with transportation costs to and from the schools. It will fund 10 of the small entrepreneurship projects of our participants. Many of these items will aid the IMPACT project for years to come. You can be sure of your investment in the project as the IMPACT team will publically post a financial report on the status of the project three times each year.

When you support impact you consciously say NO to juvenile delinquency and say YES to DIGNITY & AUTONOMY. In doing so you aid the noble cause of giving hope to youth in Haiti.

    In the event that we do not reach our set funding goal, all funding will go towards funding the small entrepreneurial projects of IMPACT's participants. We know you will help share the news and help us reach our goal.


    The Impact

    The IMPACT project will be presented at the Clinton Global Initiative 2014 (CGI U) in Phoenix, AZ from March 21st - 23rd. The project is currently a semi-finalist for Resolution Project funding that will supplement this Indiegogo campaign. 

    IMPACT will provide financial literacy and entrepreneurship education training for 100 disadvantaged high school students. We hope to decrease the dropout rate for these students as well as the possibility of them becoming prostitutes and gangsters. These 100 students will go into the world with the necessary financial and entrepreneurship training to help them make better life choices. IMPACT will instigate a paradigm shift in these students’ minds. We aim to provide young, poor students with access to the resources and tools they need to start small economic activities to sustain themselves and their families because we have walked in their shoes. Each of the students who go through the program will influence their close friends and families to participate in Haiti’s economic life. IMPACT will create the next generation of entrepreneurs instead of people waiting for the UN, IMF or a Visa to change their lives.

    Before founding IMPACT, I organized events and conferences in Haiti regarding entrepreneurship. EtreAyisyen Foundation and LEADER project of Ivey Richard Ivey School selected me among the 40 most aspiring young entrepreneurs for an entrepreneurship competition. My business studies in the US, as well as my own voracious appetite for learning about business and entrepreneurship, provide me with a uniquely well-rounded understanding of the entrepreneurship and business landscape.

    Your support is vital to the realization of this project and we are proud to count you among our supporters.  "The world is a dangerous place, not because of those who do evil, but because of those who look on and do nothing." - Albert Einstein 

    So, what are you going to do?

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are not able to contribute financially and you still want to help us, please share this message with your friends and family members.  Here are two other ways you can help us:

    Materials: You can be part of the change by donating some of the materials or resources needed. They don’t have to be new, just in good condition. If would like to donate something please email spierrejb@gmail.com or reserve a Skype/Google Hangout call to discuss how you can help.  Click here to contact IMPACT's founder, Pierre Stanley Jn Baptiste.

    IMPACT: The third way you can support is by going to our Facebook fan page to Like it and interact with us. We are looking forward to your questions and suggestions.  Click here to Like our page and share the project with your friends.

    Kenscoff

    Photo credit : Pierre Stanley Jn Baptiste

    Petion-Ville 
    Photo credit : © 2013 Flip Holsinger

story:
Project Unspell will allow people to:

1. Learn to read and write English quickly and easily without having to learn how to spell

2. Pronounce all English words correctly without memorization

3. Look up the meanings of unfamiliar words upon hearing them without guessing how they are spelled

4. Achieve perfect spelling without having to learn how to spell

Now that most text is electronic, the time has come to tackle the problem of English spelling—by auto­mating it. The ubiquitous use of spell-checkers is a relatively tiny step in the right direction: at least we know that the words we type actually exist. Unspell will take us the rest of the way: it will tell us how to pronounce each word correctly, and how to spell it correctly as well. Most importantly, it will allow us to avoid having to learn English spelling, saving a lot of time and effort.

There are two apps, one called unspell, the other called respell. The first app takes English text and, quite literally, “unspells” it, rendering it phonetically using a special set of phonetic sym­bols. When unspell gets confused (by spellings such as “tear” and “bow,” which are ambiguous), it prompts you to pick the correct pronunciation. The other app, respell, takes unspelled English and respells it back to English text. When it gets confused—do you mean “ewe” (sheep) or “yew” (tree)?— respell prompts you to pick the correct spelling, based on its intended meaning. Here's how it works:

English spelling poses a huge impediment to learning. Functional illiteracy rates in English-speaking countries run as high as 40%. English orthography was haphazard to start with; then, in the 18th century, the spellings of English words were fixed for all time, mistakes included. Since then, spoken English has evolved, but written English hasn't.

In the U.S., children spend eight years memorizing the spellings of words to achieve basic competence in written English. But eighth-grade-level reading and writing skills are too limited for most practical uses, such as understanding law, science, medicine, technology or commerce. In contrast, schoolchildren in countries where the national language has a regular, consistent orthography achieve adequate literacy in just a year or two, by memorizing a small set of rules, and are then free to learn other things. It is little wonder that many of these countries are surging ahead while English-speaking countries are falling behind. Unspell can level the playing field.

Unspell is designed to benefit the following categories of people:

  • The many adult illiterates and semi-literates who speak English fluently but who, for one reason or another, never learned to read and write well enough to be able to enjoy reading. They can learn to read Unspell by taking a brief on-line course. This will allow them to start reading any materials which they can understand when they are read to them.

  • Special needs students who, because of various learning difficulties, are unable to learn English spelling. Unspell uses simple, easily distinguished, easy to draw shapes which were specifically designed with them in mind. Unspell avoids the use of flipped, mirrored or rotated shapes that give so much trouble to dyslexics, such as p/q/d/b, u/n, y/h, w/m and s/z.

  • Home-schooled kids whose parents are pressed for time and want to get them reading anything from books on farming and animal care to masterpieces of world literature on their own quickly and without a lot of coaching.

  • ESOL students who currently have to face the hurdle of learning English spelling even though everything they need to read is available in their native language and the English skills they need are primarily oral.

  • Professionals around the world who already know how to work with written English. Many of them, being pressed for time, have never learned how to pronounce many of the words they use. They then find themselves having to participate in discussions or give talks in English. Unspell can make them sound polished with minimal effort.

  • English native speakers who would like to improve how they sound and lose their class or regional dialect in order to better integrate into society. By reading in Unspell, they will be absorbing one of the prestige dialects: Standard American English or British Received Pronunciation of news broadcasters, Hollywood actors and Masterpiece Theatre.

  • English native speakers who are not entirely comfortable working with written English, especially when it comes to spelling. A spell-checker can tell them whether something is a word, but it can't tell them whether it is the right word. Unspell can let them capture the meaning, and then they can use the respell app, which will spell most of the document automatically and guide them in choosing the correct spellings of words where necessary.

  • People with impaired vision whose eyes are strained by reading regular English text. The symbols of Unspell are specifically designed to reduce eyestrain.

  • Anyone who has ever made a fool of themselves by not knowing how to pronounce a word or a name, or by pronouncing it incorrectly.

To learn more, please visit http://unspell.it

The purpose of this fundraiser is to raise seed money, which will be used to create a functional demo of the software during the first quarter of 2014. The demo will be used to raise venture capital to complete the project.

Perks

By contributing, you will get:

  • All Unspell.it downloads for free—fonts, tools, software, training materials—everything!

  • Option to request any printed materials published by Unspell.it at cost—for the price of printing and shipping

  • Chance to be an alpha-tester for Unspell products, shape their development and help make them better

  • Your name, organization and a Web link of your choice at Unspell.it/contributors

story:
Voice for Speechless Zay

At age one and half years, the family doctor noticed that Zay is not able to say any word. He was speechless and silent. He referred us to a Speech Pathologist. After a session with Zay, she told us that Zay has signs of Autism. She referred us to a Psychologist and after four sessions with Zay, she wrote the following:

This is to confirm that Zay was seen for a psychological assessment and the following diagnosis was rendered according to DSM-5:

Autism Spectrum Disorder requiring very substantial support for deficits in social communication and requiring substantial support for restricted, repetitive behaviour, with accompanying language impairment (single words and echoed phrases).

Zay's cognitive ability currently falls in the Low Average range. His adaptive skills currently fall in the Low range.

What We Need & What You Get

We were put on the waiting lists for OCTC and CHEO Autism. Each has a two year waiting period. The psychologist told us that this is the golden age for Zay to develop and that the next two years are essential for Zay to overcome Autism or his disorder will become severe. We did not sit idle waiting for the waiting lists. We used the disability tax credit to get private therapy for Zay. The video above shows Zay in a private therapy session. He improved, he picked up some words, some good habits and some necessary skills. But the private therapy is expensive (50 CAD per hour), and we cannot continue without your help.

What you get? You change a child's life. We are asking for your donation to cover part of the cost for a year therapy for Zay.

The Impact

We are watching Zay as he is in a special need. The few words he says are so precious to us. We want more. We want to get Zay ready for Pre-School. We want him to be a typical child. We want him to succeed in this life and be independent. Your donation will help Zay progress and will change his life.
story_txt: Voice for Speechless ZayAt age one and half years, the family doctor noticed that Zay is not able to say any word. He was speechless and silent. He referred us to a Speech Pathologist. After a session with Zay, she told us that Zay has signs of Autism. She referred us to a Psychologist and after four sessions with Zay, she wrote the following:This is to confirm that Zay was seen for a psychological assessment and the following diagnosis was rendered according to DSM-5:Autism Spectrum Disorder requiring very substantial support for deficits in social communication and requiring substantial support for restricted, repetitive behaviour, with accompanying language impairment (single words and echoed phrases).Zay's cognitive ability currently falls in the Low Average range. His adaptive skills currently fall in the Low range.What We Need & What You GetWe were put on the waiting lists for OCTC and CHEO Autism. Each has a two year waiting period. The psychologist told us that this is the golden age for Zay to develop and that the next two years are essential for Zay to overcome Autism or his disorder will become severe. We did not sit idle waiting for the waiting lists. We used the disability tax credit to get private therapy for Zay. The video above shows Zay in a private therapy session. He improved, he picked up some words, some good habits and some necessary skills. But the private therapy is expensive (50 CAD per hour), and we cannot continue without your help.What you get? You change a child's life. We are asking for your donation to cover part of the cost for a year therapy for Zay.The ImpactWe are watching Zay as he is in a special need. The few words he says are so precious to us. We want more. We want to get Zay ready for Pre-School. We want him to be a typical child. We want him to succeed in this life and be independent. Your donation will help Zay progress and will change his life.

story:
The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds to provide the students of Memorial High School with personal Chromebooks. Our district is one that educates Minority students from poor socioeconomic walks of life. Most students do not possess a computer at home which makes it difficult to try and create a atmosphere where online and digital education are the norm. Our current stock of Chromebook computers are ridiculously insufficient for the amount of students in our school. It is frustrating for students to try and be fully engaged in our district's push towards digital learning when we only have 150 Chromebooks for a population of over 1800 students. Due to budget constraints in our school district, furnishing each student with a Chromebook will take years to happen, if ever. By helping us provide Chromebooks to our school, you will greatly inspire and help our students to work and become comprehensive digital learners in order to be able to become fully embedded in the nation's push towards digital learning. All donations over $300 will receive a letter of charitable donation from the students of Memorial High School.

Where is the Funding Going

Our goal is to raise $500,000 which will go towards the purchase of Chromebooks for the students of Memorial High School. We will also purchase carts, power strips and/or software for security purposes. These computers will be used in the classrooms on a daily basis to present the children with a better opportunity to learn. Once we are able to obtain enough Chromebooks for all the students then the children will be able to take them home on a daily basis.

If we are unable to reach our full goal, whatever funding we do receive will go towards the purchase of as many of these Chromebooks as possible.

If by chance we are fortunate to EXCEED our goal, ALL extra donations will go to provide badly needed computers to the rest of our districts' elementary schools.

The Impact

By helping us achieve our goal, you are making a valuable contribution to the success of our students. We believe by providing the latest technology available to our students will enhance their learning experience and will further prepare them for challenges that they face during the course of their education.

Risks & Challenges

While there are no inherent risk involved in our campaign, the challenge will be to get the word out to as many people and organizations as we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't personally contribute to our campaign, you can help get the word out over Facebook, Twitter, and other social media networks to help make as many people as possible aware of our effort.


On behalf of the students at Memorial High School, thank You for visiting and considering donating to our Campaign.

Juan J. Lugo

story:
The game that teaches you!

We are a team of students from Eindhoven University of Technology who believe that most of the world is missing out. Through the knowledge we gained in Game Design courses we gained the ability to create exactly what came up to our mind.
Programming is power!

Now we feel that it is our duty to share this knowledge.

We are developing an open-source serious game to pique interest in Computer Science. We want to provide a fun, easy and safe way to experiment with programming. The goal of the game is to teach while having fun and to be able to use your creative skills to complete levels and advance in difficulty.

If all succeeds then elementary schools and high-schools will let their pupils play this game just so that they can grasp the power of programming. The young ones will be more intrigued to continue gaining knowledge in programming and soon the world will be full of people who started programming at a young age. We hope that future generations will benefit from the increased amount of skilled programmers.

Why we need what you have

  • By funding us we will be able to give this project the time and love it needs. We are all students who spend most our spare time working to cover the in and out daily costs.


What will this game bring?

This game will be able to help people start their own campaign in the world of programming!

  • Almost everybody today is connected to the internet through one way or another.  Most of those people have no idea of how programs are developed and we want to give them an introduction to it.
  • We feel that primary education is missing out on programming, we want to give people of all ages an introduction to programming. Something that is not too difficult but still challenging. 


Basic concept

This is the story about a little robot called Jumper. Jumper lives in a dark little room of a mattress factory, where he tests the durability of mattresses by jumping on each mattress rolling over a conveyor belt. But he feels sad. He wonders what the outside world would look like.

Then one day, he discovers a glitch in the wall, and escapes to freedom. There he explores the world, and discovers that he can manipulate objects by coding.





The game will be a 2D platformer in which multiple elements are programmable, the goal is to finish jumping puzzles through modifying objects and enemies with code and commands. By adding collectables and unlockables we will make the game more appealing and fun.




What are the risks?

We are all doing a full-time major at Eindhoven University of Technology meaning our time is limited. The more we collect through funding the less time we have to work to make ourselves a living.
By contributing to this project you buy us more time to work on this game instead of working for money.

The ultimate deadline for the Alpha version of the game is 17 January.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel like this project is worth your time, but not your money then there are other ways to help;

  • Share this project with your friends and acquaintances with the Indigogo share tool!
  • Give us some ideas considering level design and aestethics.

story:
Summary

Our organization has been invited by the Ministry of Interior Co-ordination of National Government, and the Office of the Commissioner in Samburu County to attend the International Day of Zero Tolerance for FGM march and celebration on February 6, 2015 in Maralal. 

We would like to send 10 people to represent Pastoralist Child Foundation. The 10 people will be Samuel Siriria Leadismo, our Founder & Director, and 3 Samburu Elders, 3 Women and 3 Youth Leaders - all from Samburu County.  

This is a very important event for us to attend!  Please help us raise $1,000. We will meet and interact with many other stakeholders in attendance - World Vision, Red Cross, AMREF, Caritas Maralal, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Culture, Gender and Social Development, Office of the Governor, Law Enforcement and many others.

THE $1,000 RAISED IS FOR THE COST OF TRANSPORTATION, MEALS AND ACCOMODATION FOR 10 PEOPLE TO ATTEND.  WE ABSOLUTELY NEED TO BE THERE TO BE PART OF THIS IMPORTANT ANNUAL EVENT!

** If we raise more than $1,000 in this campaign we can send one extra person for every $100 that surpasses our goal.  The more people we send, the better!


The Impact

Participating with thousands of other like-minded individuals and organizations working to abolish FGM will demonstrate Pastoralist Child Foundation's sincere and devoted commitment to eradicating FGM.  We will meet many other stakeholders, government officials, nonprofit/NGO leaders, workers and volunteers.

Other Ways You Can Help

We have until February 6 to raise the funds. PLEASE contribute what you can. PLEASE share our campaign (short campaign! I'm typing really fast right now!) with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools...Facebook, Twitter, etc.

Thanks so much!  We're hopeful that you'll find a way to help us raise the money. We promise to "represent" and will post pictures from the event on all of our social media and website!  Peace and Blessings!!

story:
Our Story 

The Kris Anderson Connexions Youth Forum aims to address gender inequality within the film industry by offering female filmmakers, between the ages of 19 and 25, skills training, mentorship, hands-on experience and an all-access pass to the DOXA Documentary Film Festival.


This year DOXA is looking to the IndieGoGo community to raise funds to grow this unique youth program. Your donations will directly help aspiring filmmakers participate in all aspects of the 2012 DOXA Documentary Film Festival in May. 


With the support of the National Film Board of Canada and other partners the Connexions program offers a unique festival experience. During the 14-day intensive program, participants work with mentors to create their own documentary films and screen them at a gala festival event. 


Other program highlights include:

  • Workshops that focus on the art of documentary storytelling using digital media
  • Mentorship from established film professionals
  • Networking sessions with organizations such as the National Film Board of Canada, Knowledge Network and other film production companies
  • Opportunity to attend private receptions and exclusive events at DOXA 2012

 

"The DOXA Connexions program exceeded all my expectations. The warmth, generosity and support shown by our mentors, the NFB and the DOXA team really made us young filmmakers feel important, which is rare. I feel so charged to continue telling stories that will help make change in this world. Thank you for believing in us." -- Su-An Ng, 2010 Connexions Youth Forum participant

 

"The Connexions youth this year rocked - again! Our NFB studio here in Vancouver sure enjoyed getting to know these emerging female directors, and watching their talents unfurl over the course of the intensive filmmaking workshops. Their enthusiasm was infectious, for both DOXA and NFB, but also for the pure love of cinema." -- Tracey Friesen, Executive Producer, National Film Board of Canada, Pacific & Yukon Centre

 

Impact

It's simple: By raising $3000 we will be able to offer more workshops to more participants.


At a time when government is cutting back funding for the arts, our goal is grow the Connexions Youth Forum by offering a greater diversity of workshops to more youth participants.


Funds will help to:

  • Bring in young women from rural or Northern BC
  • Offer cutting edge workshops in animation and 3D technology
  • Bring in established industry professionals for mentorship and guidance

 

 

What We Need

$200  pays for a workshop with a film industry professional 

$500  helps provide current technology, giving participants more hands on experience

$1500 sponsors an additional Connexions participant

 

What You Get

Check out the side bar for a list of all of the amazing perks offered!

 

*Please note that all donations through IndieGoGo are in US dollars. DOXA Documentary Film Festival is presented by The Documentary Media Society, a registered charity in Canada. Tax receipts will be issued in Canadian funds for all donations above $25. Tax receipts will be issued for the amount of the donation less the cash value of your perks.  If you want to receive a tax receipt for the full amount of your donation (no perks) email joe@doxafestival.ca or call 604.646.3200. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the Word! You can help by sharing this campaign with your friends and family using Facebook and twitter. You can even embed our widget on your website or blog!

 

If you have questions about donating to DOXA and for more information about donor levels and benefit packages visit our website.

 

Or contact Joe Clark, Director of Development at joe@doxafestival.ca or 604.646.3200. 

 

About DOXA Documentary Film Festival 

DOXA is presented by the Documentary Media Society, a Vancouver based non-profit, charitable society (incorporated in 1998) devoted to presenting independent and innovative documentaries to Vancouver audiences.

 

The society exists to educate the public about documentary film as an art form through DOXA Documentary Film Festival, a curated and juried festival comprised of public screenings, panel discussions, public forums and educational programs.

 

Learn more about the DOXA Documentary Film Society and the festival by going to www.doxafestival.com

story:
Check out a detailed syllabus here.

Why Learn Data Science?


Truth is, most people will need to know how to think about data and use it to stay relevant in their fields and make a bigger impact!
Why are we teaching data science?

We could have chosen any topic to teach with our online platform - here's why we started with data science:

1. There is a lack of practical data analysis skills training for business professionals.

2. Data science creates new opportunities and helps individuals make better decisions in almost every field.

3. We want to make the maximum impact on the world - by teaching people a new way of thinking, they'll have the tools they need to make big changes.

4. There's nothing that data doesn't touch - data analysis skills will become essential to stay relevant.

What is this 'data science' business anyways and how does it interact with our world? Data scientist Harlan Harris will tell you in an excerpt from our introductory course:


So what is the value of data? Here is an excerpt from our Data Science for Business Managers course that will walk you through the massive impact that data analytics can have on your business:

How are we different?

Most online courses:

1. Teach theory or are too advanced for beginners.

2. Only provide videos without additional materials, such as reference guides or reusable templates.

3. Are dependent on one instructor to create content.

4. Are not built with instructional design from the ground up.


We've solved those problems!


All our courses are modular, so you can learn the skills you need when you need them, anytime, anywhere. Pick up a new visualization technique on your lunch break or run through a whole course in a weekend. Practice your skills with our exercises and build up your portfolio. Download our reference guides and templates so you have the tools you need at your fingertips. It's what online education should be.


Here is what our students say about us:


Education for Good

Differences in income levels should not have to result in educational deficits. Education is the universal equalizer. Practical, powerful skills are the way to bridge the gap in opportunity and standard of living. This is why we are partnering with non-profits to help those who need help the most. For every membership purchased through IndieGoGo, we will give a scholarship to someone in need, so that they can learn for free! Check out our non-profit partner, Byte Back.


Sneak Peaks

So what is this 'R' tool everyone is talking about? We walk you through what it is and how you can get it onto your computer.


Know how to use R and want to try something cool? Check out this excerpt from our Interactive Visualizations course:


Remember, it's not just these videos that you'll have access to - we also provide downloadable reference guides, R templates, practice exercises, and concept reviews so you'll be able to expand your skills to the field that you're in. Plus, forums, jobs, data sets, and plenty of additional resources on our site!


Why Do We Need Your Support?


We've spent the past year perfecting our process for creating practical, intuitive courses and have released 3 programs for you to begin your learning journey, but we still need your help. We have a full curriculum planned to help our members learn how to use data science in their current jobs, but it's going to take a lot more work to get it all done. Your contributions will help us recruit top data science experts to create materials and cover production costs.



Who Should Support Data Society?

We have built up an amazing network in Washington, D.C. and globally, and you can help us expand it further! If you want to learn data analysis skills, join a community that is passionate about solving problems, or help others get back into the workforce, become a member and support us! We are passionate about teaching everyone these in-demand skills to empower the workforce.

Finally, a big thank you to our friends and family who have supported us over the past year, and continue to encourage us as we build our courses and community education platform. Without you, we wouldn't be here (seriously, Mom and Dad, we literally wouldn't be here). 


Our Community

Data Society members are data experts and enthusiasts who share knowledge, insights, and solutions with a global community. We envision a society where data science ignites conversations and collaboration across fields to solve problems we experience every day.


Our Team

Our group of educators and data scientists is a winning combination!


Risks and challenges

We manage our team and produce our content locally, but filming of the courses could be delayed due to instructor availability. We curate the best instructors to teach our courses, and they have demanding schedules.

While we don't expect these delays to happen, should they occur, we will extend memberships to backers until all of the coursework is available while still giving them access to the existing live content.

Our biggest risk is not growing the member base fast enough. Every member who joins adds value to the community and helps others learn and improve their data science skills.

Finally, a big thank you to our friends and family who have supported us over the past year, and continue to encourage us as we build our courses and community education platform. Without you, we wouldn't be here (seriously, Mom and Dad, we literally wouldn't be here). 



Our Community
Data Society members are data experts and enthusiasts who share knowledge, insights, and solutions with a global community. We envision a society where data science ignites conversations and collaboration across fields to solve problems we experience every day.


Our Team
Our group of educators and data scientists is a winning combination!




Risks and challenges
We manage our team and produce our content locally, but filming of the courses could be delayed due to instructor availability. We curate the best instructors to teach our courses, and they have demanding schedules.
While we don't expect these delays to happen, should they occur, we will extend memberships to backers until all of the coursework is available while still giving them access to the existing live content.
Our biggest risk is not growing the member base fast enough. Every member who joins adds value to the community and helps others learn and improve their data science skills.

story:
Hello!


As some of you know, we have been working on a project to try and use the advancements in technology to reinvent the way children learn.  This started as a thought experiment a few years ago but year ago it became reality with the opening of our first learning center in Podgorica Montenegro.  


The center, which we call Phaedrus, has been such an overwhelming success that we are already at capacity and need to consider expansion.  On the surface, Phaedrus looks like any other children’s center, with puzzles and games, painting and drawing, plenty of books and some computers, laptops and tablets.  But each day something special happens there when someone unknown from someplace far away calls into the center on Skype to ask the children for their help in answering a question.  This is where the learning takes place at Phaedrus and it’s been amazing to watch the children respond to these question sessions.  To put it mildly, they love them!  


The questions can range from fun ones like,  “Why is yawning contagious?” to more serious and opaque ones like, “What is time?”  Once the question is asked the children split themselves up into groups and using the internet and the books at the center begin searching for the answer.  In this way, they are creating their own knowledge and taking ownership in their own educations and most importantly, they’re having fun doing it!  


We don’t want this email to get too long so if you’re interested in learning more about Phaedrus you can read about us on these sites…


There is a blog post about us on the website of Sugata Mitra, the 2013 TED Prize winner…


https://www.theschoolinthecloud.org/updates/podgorica-s-got-sole-by-haden-ware


And you can get some information and watch a video about Phaedrus on our website here…


www.phaedrus-centar.me


The center is a nonprofit which is completely free of charge for the children that use it.  So far we have been funding it ourselves but it has become too large a load for us to carry on our own and so we are humbly asking for your help.  


We are trying to raise enough funds to pay for the costs of the center in Montenegro and once this is covered we will begin the process of opening a sister center in Buenos Aires Argentina.  It os our dream to have hundreds of Phaedrus centers scattered throughout the developing world.  But for this dream to come true, we need your help.


If you have some spare change and feel that our project is worthy of your generosity we would be so grateful if you could make a donation.


If you don’t have the extra money to give but still want to support what we are doing it would be great if you could visit our Facebook page, like us, and maybe spread the word around to your other friends…


https://www.facebook.com/PhaedrusMNE


We have never been more excited about any project we have worked on than we are about Phaedrus.  It has been the most rewarding experience of our life and we hope to be able to continue doing this work and hopefully bring Phaedrus to numerous countries throughout the world.  


It’s an ambitious dream but we know we can get there if we just continue to put one foot in front of the other and with all of your help and support we know we can take that first big step!


Thank you all.

story:
My name is Randee Nicolay and I am enthusiastic, outgoing and committed to helping others-- A “Jack of all trades…master of none” kind of gal, EXCEPT for when it comes to building people up.  My mission is to reach out, empower, inform and encourage kids to push forward. As a first generation college student, I joined AmeriCorps to serve at-risk youth and help them navigate post-secondary education options. It was there that I developed an affinity for financial aid in its entirety. I have been fortunate enough to work with youth and adults of various cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds in Oregon’s public school system for several years now. I strongly believe in the capacity of young people to grow and change through education, and I hope to one day be able to provide them with resources I can now only dream of. 

Now, I’d like to share with you my recreational hope and desire. Theater—the underbelly of any institution of learning. (That’ll chap the hide of a thespian or two…) This specific theater opportunity is unique in that the best and brightest aspiring performers come together to achieve laughter.  Laughter is fundamental; it’s a tremendous equalizer and it amplifies our universal connection. We all laugh in the same language. The formal training I will receive through this program will act as a catalyst in developing my comedic strengths and career.

The theater in mention is The Groundlings, an improvisational theater and school located in West Hollywood California. The school itself has been the foremost comedy training ground in Hollywood since 1974 and some noteworthy Alumni (to name a few) include Phil Hartman, Cheryl Hines, Will Ferrel, Lisa Kudrow, Chris Kattan and Pat Morita. It is an innovative and challenging program that sets the standard in improvisation and sketch comedy. Admittance into the program is by audition only and the core program is comprised of four instruction levels-- all geared toward professional actors. After having passed the extension courses that serve as the prerequisites into the basic program, as well as auditioning for and being accepted into the professional Groundlings course of study in November, the next step in my journey is to migrate south for the summer months to further develop the nature of my craft.

I am seeking out tuition assistance in the amount of $1,000 for a 12 week professional technique program, as this non-traditional learning experience does not qualify for traditional financial aid assistance. Give a few cents or a dollar! Every little bit helps!

Your willingness to invest in my dreams will not soon be forgotten.

I thank you wholeheartedly for the time spent viewing my fundraising initiative.

Never stop learning,

        Randee

story:
Music and Voice Institute (MVI) ...

is a non-profit Music Academy in Banning and Beaumont California. Incorporated in 2011 MVI was created by parents and musicians to provide quality music education to our community. Our goal is to provide students  the opportunity to enhance their education and increase their ability to obtain higher education through scholarships at major universities. Our well trained and highly credentialed staff is dedicated to help each student.

Our AFTER-SCHOOL Music program is unique. It includes everything the student will need to learn to play an instrument. A major hurdle to a income-challenged community is having the ability for a family to rent an instrument. This becomes an insurmountable obstacle for most income-challenged families. Our innovative program includes a professional instructor and the instrument as part of our comprehensive package. The instruments we purchase will enable students to study at home. Not only will we fill-in the void created by ever shrinking school district budgets but we will create performing ensembles and other performance avenues. 

Change the Economic Stratus of a Community

By investing in this project you help us to affect the entire community. 66%of all Music Majors who apply to medical school are accepted. The is the single highest group. If we can help more students go to college and obtain higher paying employment we will have succeeded in our long-term goal of transforming our community. In the past few years our community has had unemployment rates at times as high as 21%. This is an opportunity to provide hope and a future. Studies show that music students score higher on SAT and other school testing. Music students are self starters, disciplined, and creative thinkers. (click this link to see a video on the topic)

What We Need & What You Get

Details

  • We need instruments. Specifically, Violins, trumpets, clarinets, trombones, marching drums, and portable pianos. 70% of your contributions will go directly to the purchase of equipment of this type.
  • 25% of your contribution will go to hiring and training new instructors for the program thus effecting our local economy through job growth

More Reasons Why You Should Support (click headline)

With Your Support You will help us to build performing ensembles that will be qualified to perform at civic and community events all over the nation (starting at home first). You will impact children and families all over our community. You will even help to reduce the education gap between ethnic groups and cultures.

If we do not reach our goal all of the funds will be used to get as many instruments as possible.

The Impact

We have a great track record with our programs. We conduct Summer Camps, Group, and Individual Instruction continuously. 

We confer with major universities to devise healthy and effective curriculum

We take it all very seriously!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Get the word out about our campaign.
  • Donate your time and Volunteer with us.
  • Donate those lonely Instruments too

story:
We are middle school students (7th and 8th graders) that go to extra help every day after school to do our homework with a helping teacher.  Even after a long day of learning, we stay because we want to get our grades up. Sometimes we don’t want to stay, but our teacher always tells us how important it is.  She tries to make her classroom a nice place for us to work, so that we do well.  Ms. Wetschensky says that we are family.

We are trying to raise money so that we can fuel our brains with very healthy food before working on our homework every day for the 2012-2013 school year.

If we had food, my teacher would be able to get more students to stay after school and not get behind in their classes or get detentions.  My teacher always tries to get students to stay but they say they are starving and have to go home after a long day.  When kids are hungry, they can’t do good work.  When kids are hungry, their behavior is bad and they don't get as much high quality work done.  This is also true for students who eat cheap junk food instead of healthy food after school. 

Contributors will help us achieve better grades because research shows that  healthy food increases good behavior and performance at school.  Contributors will help us learn about how healthy food helps our brains because we will feel the benefits of the food and experience success with our homework and learning as a result.


Your money will help all 10 students in homework lab eat a plate of food with these items everyday:

*  3 slices of cheese

*  2 slices of whole wheat toast

*  1 hard-boiled egg

*  organic jelly

*  fruit (such as apples, pears, or clementines)

*  cup of oatmeal

 (Please see our gallery materials and check out the informal research study one 7th grade student conducted to prove that this combination of food equals amazing results)

 

We will also buy reusable plates, cups, and bowls that we will wash every day, so we don't pollute the environment.

 

We researched the health benefits for each item of food on our plate and chose the ones that would benefit us most. Each one can help kids grow academically stronger because of the nutrients and proteins the food supplies. We found that healthy foods can strengthen the brain and can calm kids down. Also, this can teach kids to eat healthy outside of school when at home. If we eat healthy here, we might think about eating healthy at home. This can teach kids about what healthy foods are and how to choose well-balanced snacks.


We need the funding because some of us cannot afford to bring in food.  We also cannot afford to buy healthier food that will help us work our best.

story:
Hi,

 

My name is Keani Davis, I am in the third grade at University Heights Charter School

in Newark, New Jersey and have been nominated to represent my school and

community at the National Young Scholars Program (NYSP) this summer. The National

Young Scholars Program nominates high-achieving elementary students like me to

attend this hands-on educational and leadership program.  Since I am only in the

third grade I am still little unsure as to what I want to do when I get older.  If you are

able to contribute, attending National Young Scholarship will help me figure out which

demanding career I want to participate in.   This will be a great experience that will

help me build my leadership skills and learn all about ­­­complicated and demanding

careers like Crime Scene Investigation (CSI), examining the digestive system,

dissecting and reconstruction of a human lung.  Also I will perform patient analysis

(forensics), and build a car of the future which can be potential careers for me.  I will

be participating in all of these fields at Villanova University for a week in the summer. 

I will stay in a dorm room and I am only eight! Many eightyear olds will not have this

unique opportunity only the top five percent are nominated. 

Tuition for this amazing experience is $2,000.00.  My mom has already raised and

contributed $1,000.00 for me.  All monies will go directly to National Young Scholar

Program. I will not see or touch any of the money.  Enclosed is a copy of my grades a

press release from National Young Scholars Program and a pledge form. If you fill out

the form I will be able to mail you a thank you gift for your pledge from me or your

money back if I do not meet my goal of $1,000..00.   I hope I am able meet my goal

of $1,000.00 this is a life changing experience for an urban inner city child like

myself.  This will only open more doors for me in the future.  If you are unable to

contribute it would be appreciative if  you can spread the word about my campaign. 

Thank you in advance for contributing. I really appreciate whatever you can donate.

http://www.nationalyoungscholars.org/index.cfm

story:
Our Story


               The Chinese government is using deadly force to respond to the calls of Tibetans in Tibet for more freedoms and human rights. Because China will not allow western media into Tibetan areas it is hard to ascertain how many Tibetans have been killed, but, as CCP soldiers and police have flooded into Tibet, human rights and Tibetan advocacy groups fear the worst.

Amid this atmosphere of rebellion and oppression, young Tibetans have begun to, literally, set themselves on fire as a last resort form of protest. At last count, 25 Tibetans have set fire to themselves in eastern Tibet; twelve since 6 January 2012. At least 18 have died. The young men and women, usually Buddhist monks and nuns, who committed these desperate acts called for freedom in Tibet and the return of the Dalai Lama to Tibet while flames engulfed them.

This campaign is being launched on March 10, 2012 to help commemorate Tibetan National Uprising Day. All over the world, Tibetans and Tibet supporters will take to the streets to raise awareness of the situation in Tibet and send a clear message to the Chinese government: Despite all of your violence and oppression the Tibetan people and their supporters will not give up. End the violence in Tibet; end oppression in Tibet. Tibet will be free.

The Impact


Students for a Free Tibet (SFT) works in solidarity with the Tibetan people in their struggle for freedom and independence. We are a chapter-based network of young people and activists around the world. Through education, grassroots organizing, and non-violent direct action, we campaign for Tibetansâ€™ fundamental right to political freedom. Our role is to empower and train youth as leaders in the worldwide movement for social justice.


The work SFT is effective and translates into real and positive change in Chinese occupied Tibet.


For more info visit:

http://www.studentsforafreetibet.org/


What We Need & What You Get

Without donations from people like you, the work SFT does would, quite simply, not get done. Please donate! Even small donations really add up!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please take a second to forward this campaign to anyone you feel might be able to help - THANK YOU!

story:
SWB Campaign Summary

Hey Butterflies, it’s me Diana Ramsey. The Head Curl in charge and force behind the premier natural hair website, SistersWithBeauty, I've been able to provide a certain level of professionalism and quality. After attending Blogging While Brown conference in NY, I realized the more support I get from Butterflies like you, the better I can make the site and experience of going to www.sisterswithbeauty.com. Attending another conference is a great way to put SistersWithBeauty website in front of sponsors and other people who are in the business of helping grow websites to their highest potential. 

The lessons from a conference like Blogalicious are priceless. But there is just one thing; it isn't priceless in regards to my travels, registration, rental car, and incidentals. So what do I need? Well it's simple, I need your support. Your contribution will help me learn more about the theme of the Blogalicious conference- Create. Build. Fund. SistersWithBeauty has already been created, and we are currently building and laying the necessary blocks for its premier Do-It-Yourself status. Now we must be on to funding, and you being a part of a website designed just for you. Please consider contributing to the effort of my attendance. Just $1.00 would make a real difference. No price is too small a contribution for a site that believes in you. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm trying to raise a minimum of $1000, to be split between the conference registration fee, flight, rental car, and incidentals. (but a lesser %age is collected by IndieGogo if we meet this goal). If we don't meet the goal, I will still be able to use the funds towards the trip, I will be responsible for paying a high percentage from IndieGogo. 

All contributions will recieve a special shout out on the SistersWithBeauty Facebook FanPage and Instagram

HYPNOEARS SPONSORED GIVEAWAY: 

$10.00 contribution will get 5 people Electric Blue Hippies Earrings. HypnoEars has been so gracious to provide this sponsored giveaway. Be sure to show HypnoEars some love by liking them on FB.

HypnoEars FB: https://www.facebook.com/HypnoEars?fref=ts

Check out the Hippies in action below:

Do You Naturally Sponsored Giveaway:

Every client of Do You Naturally that contributes with proof will be entered into a drawing to win a FREE service. You'll need to identify youself as a client of Veola Jolly in order to be entered. Your email contribution will be forwarded to Veola after you contribute. Just one dollar will enter you into the drawing.

Be sure to show Do You Naturally some love by liking them on FB.

Do You Naturally: https://www.facebook.com/DoYouNaturally?fref=ts

Tier 1: $25.00 contributions you will receive a special shout out on the SistersWithBeauty Facebook FanPage and Instagram and one private style video.

Tier 2: $50 contributions you wil receive a special shout out on the SistersWithBeauty Facebook FanPage and Instagram, BOTH private style videos. 

Tier 3: $75 contributions you will receive a Natural Hair Counseling session, to be used on you or a friend. If you believe you don't need the session you can nominate someone else. 

Natural Hair Counseling Session includes:

  • 30 minute One-on-One Video Chat with Diana Ramsey
  • Natural Plan Document 
  • One private style video (You choose Bender Ride Twist or Cotton Club Twist)

Tier 4: $100 or more contribution you will recieve all perks from Tier 1-3

  • Private style video
  • Review on few products I've been using since inception
  • 30 minute One-on-One Video Chat with Diana Ramsey
  • Natural Plan Document

The Impact

Attending the Blogalicious conference will put me in front of a wide span of Fortune 500 business, celebrities, and subject-matter experts in a variety of industries that impact our lives as social media influencers. My attendance and intention for Blogalicious is to create more opportinties for the followers of SistersWithBeauty; through networking and establishing working business relationships.

Any amount will help. $1, $3, $5, $10, $20, $50 (+ a Butterfly Acts of kindness).

Please consider making a donation and pledging a Butterfly Acts of kindness to this effort. All contributions will get a shout out across SistersWithBeauty social networking channels.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can't help us meet our goal. Help spread the word about the campaign by sharing all fb statuses, tweets, IG photos, and videos. 

Thanks so much for your time. I look forward to crossing the finishline a true success. 

 

Butterflies UP!!

Diana Ramsey

Head Curl in Charge

www.sisterswithbeauty.com
story_txt:
SWB Campaign Summary
Hey Butterflies, it’s me Diana Ramsey. The Head Curl in charge and force behind the premier natural hair website, SistersWithBeauty, I've been able to provide a certain level of professionalism and quality. After attending Blogging While Brown conference in NY, I realized the more support I get from Butterflies like you, the better I can make the site and experience of going to www.sisterswithbeauty.com. Attending another conference is a great way to put SistersWithBeauty website in front of sponsors and other people who are in the business of helping grow websites to their highest potential. 
The lessons from a conference like Blogalicious are priceless. But there is just one thing; it isn't priceless in regards to my travels, registration, rental car, and incidentals. So what do I need? Well it's simple, I need your support. Your contribution will help me learn more about the theme of the Blogalicious conference- Create. Build. Fund. SistersWithBeauty has already been created, and we are currently building and laying the necessary blocks for its premier Do-It-Yourself status. Now we must be on to funding, and you being a part of a website designed just for you. Please consider contributing to the effort of my attendance. Just $1.00 would make a real difference. No price is too small a contribution for a site that believes in you.

story:
Pinson Public Library has been opened since October 2011. This summer marks our 3rd Summer Reading Program.  We have grown so much in such a short amount of time and we need your help to continue to grow! 

In 2012, during our first year of SRP, we offered 14 programs for teens and children. Last year we offered 40 programs for teens, children and adults.This year we want to offer a program a day during the summer!!!

We will offer activities for children, events for teens, programs for adults and more! This includes programs about music/art/science, craft events, animal visits and family night programs.

Just a few reasons it is important to have an engaging Summer Reading Program: 

  • offers encouragement that reading become a lifelong habit
  • reading over the summer helps children prevent the "summer slide"
  • programs provide an opportunity for family time

How much would it cost your family to travel to a neighboring city to visit a family friendly venue? For a family of 4 the cost would be well over $50. Your donation, no matter what the amount ($5, $20, $50, $200) will help us offer more programs! We can stretch your dollars to provide quality entertainment for you and your entire family.

 Help us reach our goal of "A Program a Day!" for our 2014 Summer Reading Program!

story:
Short Summary

Last year I left my job in social media advertising to return to full time studies at Ryerson University (while working part time). I am in the Graphic Communications Management Program and will graduate with a Bachelor of Technology. Obviously school is really expensive and so is life. I work, I freelance, I do doors at shows / run events when I can. I clip coupons and I cut back and try to cut costs where I can. I just want to be able to pay my tuition and not feel like I am either going to starve, go homeless/have to move 1.5 hours away from school, have to sell my things, or not be able to remain in school. So help me be able to be a person and be awesome at life by kicking ass at school. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $5000 ... my tuition is actually closer to 7 grand. However I will honestly take any help. I hate asking but times are tough. 

If you help I will bake you things. I am awesome at baking bread. Or 3D dinosaur cookies of your choosing (there are 4 different ones). When i graduate I will send you a pic of me with my diploma in a derpy cap and gown standing in front of Maple Leaf Gardens (that's where they hold convocation now). 

The Impact

I have a 3.8 GPA. The only thing that brings me down is stress over money. 
My degree is in technology management - we need more women who are passionate about technology getting educated and being in the feild. 
I am 30 and I believe this is my time to make my life better, and since I left work to go back to school only good things have happened to me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me share this or if you know me personally maybe bring me a casserole. I will repay you in fresh baked bread and smiles.
