story:
Help us reach our stretch goal of $4,000!

We’ve successfully raised $3,000 for tuition support, facilitator training, and computer access.  Now we’re setting our sights a little higher with a stretch goal of $4,000 to expand our operating budget.  

Our operating budget goes towards:

  • Participant project budgets

  • Diverse supplies

  • Overhead including rent and utilities

  • Guest presentations

  • Furniture


Reaching our stretch goal will bring us closer to making Endor the best it can be and it will help us keep costs low for participants in the semesters to come.


A HUGE thank you to everyone that has already contributed.  It’s really great to see so many people come together to support our project.

-The Endor Team



What's the most important thing you ever learned? Where did you learn it?

Maybe it was how to tie your shoes, balance a checkbook, or drive a car. Maybe it came from on-the-job training, a great novel, or a bad break-up.

It inspired you to take action. It made you to talk to others. It helped you think about what you learned in a way that made it real. 

Because of all that, it's probably not something that you, along with millions of others, learned in school and only remembered while watching "Are You Smarter Than A Fifth Grader?"

The Endor Initiative is a self-directed learning environment where learning takes on this kind of realness, providing an alternate to "teach to the test" schools in Asheville, North Carolina.

We'd love your support in attending Agile Learning Center training this summer, and to fund participants and supplies for our program next fall.


Who is Endor? What's an Agile Learning Center?

Endor is a place to honor what our high school aged participants bring to the table (no curriculum: participants determine what’s worth spending time on), do away with systems of ranking (no grades: participants create internal measurements of value), break down hierarchies (no teachers), and provide a system of community and peer supported education (the local Endor and global Agile Learning Center ecosystems) that are missing from most traditional school philosophies and environments.

Agile Learning Centers are an educational model for communities of happy, actualized people in a network that shares resources, tools, and experiences. Endor and the ALCs believe that learning happens in cycles of intention, creation, and reflection, and facilitators work with participants to develop these skills. You can read more about ALCs here: http://agilelearningcenters.org/

What We Need & What You Get

Want to support us in this generative new model of education?! We aim to raise $3000, contributing:

  • $1000 towards Endor Facilitators attending Agile Learning Facilitator (ALF) Summer training 
  •  $1000 towards tuition support for Endor participants
  •  $1000 towards Chromebooks for Endor participants

In exchange, we're excited to offer you:

  • Unique Endor baseball T-shirts (there are also a few 2011 and 2013 Endor pocket T-shirts available!)
  • Original music
  • Home baked cakes
  • Golden stickers
  • and more. . .

If we don't reach our $3000 goal, our #1 priority is to get our facilitators to the ALF Summer, which will ultimately support both our participants and the ALC ecosystem. Our second priority is making Endor affordable, and will go towards tuition support for our participants. Our third priority for this campaign is to increase our participants' access to computers. 

In addition, all of the documentation created at ALF Summer is open source, so you too can benefit from our experimentation!


The Impact

We often get our understanding of what has value, and even of why we have value, from structures outside of our day-to-day control (like our government or mass media). 

We believe that when human beings determine how to spend our time, we gain the skills to create our reality, take responsibility for our choices, and create an internal sense of our value and what's worth doing. 

This model challenges the way many of us work and learn, which is likely inside of big-system structures that we didn't help create.   

Our ultimate vision is that practicing these collaborative learning processes with our participants will make our entire community more likely to make decisions that support the health of our environment, our lives, and our humanity. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate right now, but believe in our mission? We believe in you too!

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about Endor!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share us with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and more. 
  • If you have skills or expertise you would like to share at Endor, contact us at info@endorinitiative.com

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Help us reach our stretch goal of $4,000! 
We’ve successfully raised $3,000 for tuition support, facilitator training, and computer access.  Now we’re setting our sights a little higher with a stretch goal of $4,000 to expand our operating budget.  
Our operating budget goes towards:

Participant project budgets
Diverse supplies
Overhead including rent and utilities 
Guest presentations
Furniture

Reaching our stretch goal will bring us closer to making Endor the best it can be and it will help us keep costs low for participants in the semesters to come.
A HUGE thank you to everyone that has already contributed.  It’s really great to see so many people come together to support our project.
-The Endor Team

What's the most important thing you ever learned? Where did you learn it? Maybe it was how to tie your shoes, balance a checkbook, or drive a car. Maybe it came from on-the-job training, a great novel, or a bad break-up. It inspired you to take action. It made you to talk to others. It helped you think about what you learned in a way that made it real.  Because of all that, it's probably not something that you, along with millions of others, learned in school and only remembered while watching "Are You Smarter Than A Fifth Grader?" The Endor Initiative is a self-directed learning environment where learning takes on this kind of realness, providing an alternate to "teach to the test" schools in Asheville, North Carolina. 
We'd love your support in attending Agile Learning Center training this summer, and to fund participants and supplies for our program next fall. 


Who is Endor? What's an Agile Learning Center? 

Endor is a place to honor what our high school aged participants bring to the table (no curriculum: participants determine what’s worth spending time on), do away with 
systems of ranking (no grades: participants create internal measurements
 of value), break down hierarchies (no teachers), and provide a system 
of community and peer supported education (the local Endor and global 
Agile Learning Center ecosystems) that are missing from most traditional
 school philosophies and environments. Agile Learning Centers are an educational model for communities of happy, actualized people in a network that shares resources, tools, and experiences. Endor and the ALCs believe that learning happens in cycles of intention, creation, and reflection, and facilitators work with participants to develop these skills. You can read more about ALCs here: http://agilelearningcenters.org/
  What We Need & What You Get 
Want to support us in this generative new model of education?! We aim to raise $3000, contributing: 
  $1000 towards Endor Facilitators attending Agile Learning Facilitator (ALF) Summer training 
 $1000 towards tuition support for Endor participants 

 $1000 towards Chromebooks for Endor participants


In exchange, we're excited to offer you: 
 Unique Endor baseball T-shirts (there are also a few 2011 and 2013 Endor pocket T-shirts available!)

Original music
Home baked cakes
Golden stickers
and more. . .


If we don't reach our $3000 goal, our #1 priority is to get our facilitators to the ALF Summer, which will ultimately support both our participants and the ALC ecosystem. Our second priority is making Endor affordable, and will go towards tuition support for our participants. Our third priority for this campaign is to increase our participants' access to computers. 
In addition, all of the documentation created at ALF Summer is open source, so you too can benefit from our experimentation!

    The Impact 
We often get our understanding of what has value, and even of why we have value, from structures outside of our day-to-day control (like our government or mass media). 
We believe that when human beings determine how to spend our time, we gain the skills to create our reality, take responsibility for our choices, and create an internal sense of our value and what's worth doing. 
This model challenges the way many of us work and learn, which is likely inside of big-system structures that we didn't help create.   
Our ultimate vision is that practicing these collaborative learning processes with our participants will make our entire community more likely to make decisions that support the health of our environment, our lives, and our humanity. 


    Other Ways You Can Help Can't donate right now, but believe in our mission? We believe in you too!  Help us get the word out and make some noise about Endor! Use the Indiegogo share tools to share us with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and more. 
If you have skills or expertise you would like to share at Endor, contact us at info@endorinitiative.com
   And that's all there is to it.

story:
WHAT IS MUSIC CROSSROADS?

Music Crossroads is a non-profit organisation supporting music education in the culturally rich Southern African region. Our unique Academies in Mozambique, Malawi and Zimbabwe, established in 2013, empower talented young musicians through an affordable and innovative music education program. 

Approximately 65 million people live in the three countries where Music Crossroads has Academies. These countries are immensely rich in musical traditions and talent, but an underdeveloped music industry and a lack of access to quality music education makes it difficult for young musicians to make a living in the creative sector.

Music Crossroads is a program of Jeunesses Musicales International. Read more on our website: www.music-crossroads.net.




OUR GOAL:

Our goal is to raise $5000. This is the amount needed to support 10 deserving musical talents through a one-year Professional Certificate Program at one of our Academies. 

Thanks to our sponsors, we can offer a very low tuition fee. But there are still many talented musicians from underprivileged backgrounds who are unable to afford the program. Often, they are the ones who could benefit the most.

By helping us reach our goal, you are giving a young musician access to a quality education, as well as supporting the development of the creative sector in the region.

Let's make a difference through music!


PERKS:


With a donation of $10 you can take one of these tote bags or one framed print with our african patterns.
Choose between the elephant, the giraffe or the hut!

---
We can offer you 4 prints made by Mozambican artist
and illustrator missphips!
You can receive one for a donation of $20, two for $40 and the full collection (including four framed prints) for $50.


---

The Italian artist DEM donated this art piece for our campaign!
For a donation of $25 we will give you a framed print with this drawing.


---
For a donation of $200 you'll receive a beautiful handmade painting by Kingsley Maigwa, an artist from Malawi. Each one is unique, so we can send you the pictures of these paintings allowing you to choose which one you want! 



OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

Even if you can't contribute (or if you already have and would like to help us even more): Please share this campaign with your friends and family!

Every single contribution matters for our students and their future in music!

story:
My name is Harpreet Kaur and I am a British born Indian. I have been invited to join Jagriti Yatra, an annual 15 day journey across India, a non-profit initiative that aims to build India through enterprise. 


On 24 December 2014 I plan to board a train with 450 young people aged 20-27 years old from all over the country to lead development by taking to enterprise. The journey is to nurture job creators and leaders rather than job seekers, and for the past 5 years this movement has successfully lead to the creation of enterprises in small towns, villages and cities all over India. 


The train stops at specific destinations for participants to meet inspirational change-makers in those places. These change-makers are role models who are pursuing commendable Nation Building work in their communities and domains. The Yatra is also joined by accomplished 'Resource Persons, leaders from business and marketing, and the following areas of development: 

  1. Agriculture
  2. Education
  3. Energy
  4. Healthcare
  5. Manufacturing
  6. Water & Sanitation
  7. Arts, Culture & Sport
My area of expertise is Arts and Culture so I will work with the young people to develop creative programmes. I am an arts manager with over 13 years of international experience in project/events management and marketing across the performing and visual arts, including South Asian Arts. 

I have an interest in women's equality and human security, so am particularly interested in creative projects with an intention to create social, political and environmental change within and between nations. As an advocate for cultural diplomacy, I continue working internationally on initiatives that celebrate culture, art and development, so have ample knowledge and hands on experience to share with the young people. 

As a young British Indian woman that is incredibly proud and passionate of my Punjabi heritage, I know how fortunate I am to have access to education and opportunities in the West. When we educate a woman, we educate a community.  Participating in Jagriti Yatra 2014 will allow me to share my expertise in a country where I understand the culture and speak the local language; it is my second home that I have a responsibility to support. The arts have a huge role to play in creating change and building peace. 

I am covering the costs of my flights and visa, but need your support to cover my fee of £900 to participate in this world-changing project. The journey is run by a not for profit charity called Jagriti Sewa Sansthan, and is made possible through voluntary action and financial contributions by all participating to make it a reality. Any amount you can offer will be invaluable to allow my participation in the project. Thank you so much for your support, that will encourage the appreciation and practice of creativity to build a better India.


Jagriti Yatra: www.jagritiyatra.com

Harpreet Kaur: www.harpreetkaurcreative.wordpress.com

story:
What is the project?

The Developing Nations Entrepreneurship Showcase is the final step in the Change the World Internships initiative, a global partnership whose goal is to train young leaders, promote sustainable development, and create new jobs in local communities. Before the Showcase, these young entrepreneurs have already been through a rigorous, life-changing training program, including:

1) Creating and submitting a comprehensive proposal for a social or business entrepreneurship that creates jobs in local communities and makes a difference in their society

2) If accepted into the initiative, attending a bootcamp and getting trained in leadership and business skills

3) Completing the Change the World Internship, a 4-month virtual internship which includes mentoring to take their ideas to the next level by creating an action plan and working with leading entrepreneurs to refine and implement their business goals. This involves online training, speaking with potential customers to validate their business model, final revisions, creating a working proof of concept, and finally, pitching their initiative to a panel of judges (all seasoned entrepreneurs).

2 teams from the Caribbean and 2 from India have been chosen as the winners of this initiative.

The prize: Coming to the U.S. in October to showcase their work at the U.N. and in Washington, D.C. at the Developing Nations Entrepreneurship Showcase.

Why is this important?

There are 73 million young men and women around the world who are unemployed — especially in the developing world. Empowering a person with the skills and training needed to lead their community and create work opportunities can completely transform their own lives, and the lives of those around them.

Who We Are

Driven by our passion and purpose, the teams of A Million for A Billion (1M1B) and the Global Leadership Coalition (GLC) have come together to pilot CHANGE THE WORLD INTERNSHIPS. Rather than outside 'experts' coming into communities with often ineffective, surface solutions, we are engaging the local community to solve their own problems and generate employment.

             

The core team members of the Change the World Internships are a group of diverse and dedicated game changers, several of whom have left full-time corporate jobs to pursue their passion and purpose in making a difference for others. We have experience and expertise in business, entrepreneurship, social innovation, healthcare, international development, multilateral engagement, communication, education, music, media and journalism. We are united in our belief that the world functions holistically, and that collectively people — and especially youth and women — have the power to act and create our future.
(See our team here and here)

What is our goal?

We Need $36,000 to make this happen. We have invested our time and resources to get the Entrepreneurship Challenge initiative to this stage, and now we need you for the final push. The money we are raising will enable the finalists to come to New York in October to showcase their solutions at the U.N., and to Washington D.C. if we reach our stretch goal.

Where does the money go?

The sum total of $36,000 goes directly to fund travel, hotel, and meals for a 3-day trip to New York for 12 people — 8 entrepreneurs and 4 country program managers. This breaks down to:

• $4,000 per person for 6 people from India, including 4 Entrepreneurs and 2 Program Managers;

• $3,000 per person for 3 people from the Caribbean, including 2 Entrepreneurs and 1 Support Staff;

• $1,000 per person for 3 people from US, including 2 Entrepreneurs and 1 Program Manager.

Stretch goals

Stretch Goal 1: Trip to Washington, D.C.

With an additional $18,000 we will extend the trip by 2 days and take the teams to Washington, D.C., where they will be given an opportunity to present their businesses to various multilateral and bilateral organizations, government officials, investors, and venture capitalists at a special event hosted by Washington, D.C.- based investor group DC ArchAngels.

Stretch Goal 2: Marketing & Promotion of Project Success

An additional $18,000 will give us the funding to document the project including creating videos, case studies and brochures, which will be used to promote the organization as we move into our 2016 program.

Get involved

We appreciate you taking this time to read about our work and this campaign! Please help us get the word out by promoting this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+, and any other social networks you’re on. The quickest way is to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Like our Facebook pages: https://www.facebook.com/amillionforabillion AND https://www.facebook.com/GlobalLeadershipCoalition

Follow us on Twitter: @Activate1M1B AND @GLCIntl

Visit and share our websites: www.activate1m1b.blogspot.in AND at http://globalleadershipcoalition.com

story: My name is Tylar and I am a freshman vocal music education major at Oklahoma State University. My choir, the OSU Concert Chorale, has been given the wonderful opportunity to tour Italy in the summer of 2017. This will be my first time out of the USA and I am very excited to experience the beauty and rich culture of Italy while sharing my love and passion of music while there. Any donation is greatly appreciated and I'm excited to go on this life-changing trip with some of my closest friends and colleagues!

story:
We want to conduct 24 housing improvements in order to help 24 rural families, who are in poverty conditions, so that they can start their rural tourism business; by providing this , their incomes will increase and so their welfare. 

Let us tell you the story in English you can find below.

Necesitamos hacer 24 mejoramientos de vivienda para que familias campesinas en condición de pobreza inicien sus emprendimientos en turismo rural comunitario de esta forma, ellos aumentarán sus ingresos y podrán mejorar su calidad de vida.

Te contamos la historia:

¿Que es Ruralive?

Ruralive Colombia, es un Negocio Social diseñado para que a través de servicios turísticos, las familias rurales de Caldas y Colombia generen ingresos adicionales que les permita mejorar sus viviendas, puedan tener acceso a servicios de salud, educación, nutrición y de esta forma mejoren su calidad vida.



¿de donde surgió esta idea?

Ruralive Colombia es una iniciativa del Movimiento Holístico de Negocios Sociales de Grameen Caldas siguiendo los 7 principios  del Prof. Muhammad Yunus, Premio Nobel de Paz, quien define un Negocio Social como una herramienta para erradicar la pobreza al solucionar un problema social de forma autosostenible. (ver más sobre Negocios Sociales)

Siguiendo este principio Ruralive Colombia está enfocado en solucionar problemas de habitabilidad de las familias campesinas en condiciones de pobreza y pobreza extrema. (ver más sobre Ruralive)

¿por qué esta campaña?

Ruralive está apenas en su primer año de lanzamiento al mercado y ya hemos recibido  150 viajeros de todas partes del mundo: Argentina, Chile, Perú, Brasil, España, Alemania, Italia, Portugal, Francia, Japón, Suecia, Bélgica, Australia y otros 10 países. Pero solo tenemos 6 familias, por eso necesitamos que mas familias ingresen a nuestro programa de turismo rural y así puedan salir de la pobreza, hay 18 familias esperando  ingresar a nuestro programa y para ellos necesitamos mejorar sus viviendas y la de las 6 familias que ya están vinculadas.

¿Cuanto cuesta el proyecto?

Para poder hacer estos mejoramientos, hemos tocado las puertas de organizaciones y empresas para que a través de sus donaciones pudiéramos logralo. El proyecto  cuesta $8.600 dólares y ya tenemos $5.000, solo nos falta recoger $3.600 dólares para poder realizar las obras.


Para saber más del proyecto puedes ver al final de este texto

¿Cuáles son las recompensas?

Después de mucho pensar cual sería la mejor forma de recompensarte por tu gran corazón y por creer en nuestro proyecto, decidimos que nada nos haría más feliz que hacerte miembro de nuestra comunidad.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

No todos tiene opción de donar dinero pero cualquier ayuda es muy importante. Como nos puedes ayudar?

  • Ingresa a nuestra fanpage y apóyanos difundiendo nuestro programa.
  • Comparte esta campaña con tus amigos.
  • Utiliza las herramientas de difusión de Indiegogo, esto nos ayudará a tener más visibilidad.
  • Visita nuestros destinos Ruralive en Colombia, a  partir del 2015, empezaremos nuestra expansión a otros países de América Latina y el Caribe.

 ¡Agradecemos tu apoyo mucho y esperamos que te animes a unirte a la gran familia Ruralive!

English version

What is Ruralive?

Ruralive Colombia is a Social Business which focuses on tourism services by means of which rural families improve their incomes as well as their housing problems. They also have health care services, education and nutrition thus they will have a better quality of life.

How did this happen?

Ruralive Colombia emerges as a response of Grameen Caldas’ Holistic Movement of Social Business, following the Professor Muhammad Yunus’ principles, who defines a Social Business as a tool for poverty eradication, created with the aim of solving social problems in a self-sustaining way. According to this, rural families earn their own money through hosting services provided to tourists. 


Why this campaign?

Nowadays, there are only six families in Ruralive’s program, taking into account that
Ruralive opened just a year ago. Nevertheless, we have provided tourism services to more than 140 travelers from all over the world (Argentina, Chile, Peru, Brazil, Spain, Germany, Italy, Portugal, France, Japan, Sweden, Belgium, Australia and 10 other countries). We actually have other 18 families waiting to be part of Ruralive Colombia; therefore, we need this program to be expanded to many more people to meet the needs of these families.

In order to make these improvements, we knocked on the doors of companies and organizations that through their donations could achieve this. The project costs are US$8,600 and we already have US$5000, we only need to collect US$3,600 dollars to carry out the Works.

What if we do not collect all the money?

Each family requires $150 and so to cover the 24 families that are part of our initiative, we need a total of $3,600. Should we not reach our goal, we have decided to allocate the funds to those most in need and cover the full amount for an entire home improvement rather than split the funds amongst all families.

  • $150 = 1 family
  • $750 = 5 families
  • $1,300 = 10 families
  • $2,600 = 20 families
  • $3,600 = 24 families

Nonetheless, we expect to be able to fully fund the program!

What if we collect more than expected?

All the money collected will be invested in the quality of life of these families which
will be reflected in the increase of tourists who will feel safe and comfortable while staying with our rural families. Every single step we take, with your help, is a closer goal to have more families overcoming poverty.

How does the reward work?

After spending a lot of time thinking about how to reward you in the best way, for supporting our project, we have decided to include you as a member of our
community. For that reason, we have created a membership system exclusively for
you.


  • Do you want to travel to different places of Colombia? Perhaps you plan to go to Latin America or the Caribbean? Then, this is for you.
  • Do you know someone who plans to travel? Help us recommending this campaign to your friends!

Some other ways to help

We know that not everyone has option to donate money but any help is very
important. How can you help?

  • Go to our fanpage and share this information.
  • Use the Indiegogo broadcasting tools; this will help us to have more visibility. 
  • Visit our Ruralive destinations in Colombia, from 2015, we will begin our expansion to other countries in Latin America and the Caribbean, so you have many options to choose from.


_________________

Mas información sobre la campaña

¿Qué pasa si no recogemos todo?

No queremos dejar mejoramientos de vivienda a la mitad por eso hemos decido que si no logramos reunir todo el dinero cubriremos la cantidad de familias que alcancemos a pagar con el total recaudado

  • $150 = 1 familia
  • $750 = 5 familias
  • $1300 = 10 familias
  • $2600 = 20 familias
  • $36000 = 24 familias

Sin embargo, estamos confiados que lograremos recaudar el total de nuestro objetivo.

¿Que pasa si recaudamos más del objetivo?

Todo el dinero que recibamos será invertido en mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrecemos para que así mas turistas quieran venir a hospedarse con nuestras familias campesinas. Cada pasito que damos, con tu ayuda, nos acerca más al objetivo de ver a muchas familia fuera de la pobreza.

También puedes visitar nuestra página para saber más de Ruralive:

RURALIVE COLOMBIA
story_txt:
We want to conduct 24 housing improvements in order to help 24 rural families, who are in poverty conditions, so that they can start their rural tourism business; by providing this , their incomes will increase and so their welfare. 
Let us tell you the story in English you can find below.
Necesitamos hacer 24 mejoramientos de vivienda para que familias campesinas en condición de pobreza inicien sus emprendimientos en turismo rural comunitario de esta forma, ellos aumentarán sus ingresos y podrán mejorar su calidad de vida.
Te contamos la historia:
¿Que es Ruralive?
Ruralive Colombia, es un Negocio Social diseñado para que a través de servicios turísticos, las familias rurales de Caldas y Colombia generen ingresos adicionales que les permita mejorar sus viviendas, puedan tener acceso a servicios de salud, educación, nutrición y de esta forma mejoren su calidad vida.



¿de donde surgió esta idea?
Ruralive Colombia es una iniciativa del Movimiento Holístico de Negocios Sociales de Grameen Caldas siguiendo los 7 principios  del Prof. Muhammad Yunus, Premio Nobel de Paz, quien define un Negocio Social como una herramienta para erradicar la pobreza al solucionar un problema social de forma autosostenible. (ver más sobre Negocios Sociales)
Siguiendo este principio Ruralive Colombia está enfocado en solucionar problemas de habitabilidad de las familias campesinas en condiciones de pobreza y pobreza extrema. (ver más sobre Ruralive)
¿por qué esta campaña?Ruralive está apenas en su primer año de lanzamiento al mercado y ya hemos recibido  150 viajeros de todas partes del mundo: Argentina, Chile, Perú, Brasil, España, Alemania, Italia, Portugal, Francia, Japón, Suecia, Bélgica, Australia y otros 10 países. Pero solo tenemos 6 familias, por eso necesitamos que mas familias ingresen a nuestro programa de turismo rural y así puedan salir de la pobreza, hay 18 familias esperando  ingresar a nuestro programa y para ellos necesitamos mejorar sus viviendas y la de las 6 familias que ya están vinculadas.
¿Cuanto cuesta el proyecto?
Para poder hacer estos mejoramientos, hemos tocado las puertas de organizaciones y empresas para que a través de sus donaciones pudiéramos logralo. El proyecto  cuesta $8.600 dólares y ya tenemos $5.000, solo nos falta recoger $3.600 dólares para poder realizar las obras.


Para saber más del proyecto puedes ver al final de este texto
¿Cuáles son las recompensas?
Después de mucho pensar cual sería la mejor forma de recompensarte por tu gran corazón y por creer en nuestro proyecto, decidimos que nada nos haría más feliz que hacerte miembro de nuestra comunidad.



Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
No todos tiene opción de donar dinero pero cualquier ayuda es muy importante. Como nos puedes ayudar?

Ingresa a nuestra fanpage y apóyanos difundiendo nuestro programa.
Comparte esta campaña con tus amigos.
Utiliza las herramientas de difusión de Indiegogo, esto nos ayudará a tener más visibilidad.
Visita nuestros destinos Ruralive en Colombia, a  partir del 2015, empezaremos nuestra expansión a otros países de América Latina y el Caribe.

 ¡Agradecemos tu apoyo mucho y esperamos que te animes a unirte a la gran familia Ruralive!
English version
What is Ruralive?
Ruralive Colombia is a Social Business which focuses on tourism services by means of which rural families improve their incomes as well as their housing problems. They also have health care services, education and nutrition thus they will have a better quality of life.
How did this happen?
Ruralive Colombia emerges as a response of Grameen Caldas’ Holistic Movement of Social Business, following the Professor Muhammad Yunus’ principles, who defines a Social Business as a tool for poverty eradication, created with the aim of solving social problems in a self-sustaining way. According to this, rural families earn their own money through hosting services provided to tourists. 



Why this campaign?
Nowadays, there are only six families in Ruralive’s program, taking into account thatRuralive opened just a year ago. Nevertheless, we have provided tourism services to more than 140 travelers from all over the world (Argentina, Chile, Peru, Brazil, Spain, Germany, Italy, Portugal, France, Japan, Sweden, Belgium, Australia and 10 other countries). We actually have other 18 families waiting to be part of Ruralive Colombia; therefore, we need this program to be expanded to many more people to meet the needs of these families.
In order to make these improvements, we knocked on the doors of companies and organizations that through their donations could achieve this. The project costs are US$8,600 and we already have US$5000, we only need to collect US$3,600 dollars to carry out the Works.
What if we do not collect all the money?
Each family requires $150 and so to cover the 24 families that are part of our initiative, we need a total of $3,600. Should we not reach our goal, we have decided to allocate the funds to those most in need and cover the full amount for an entire home improvement rather than split the funds amongst all families.

$150 = 1 family
$750 = 5 families
$1,300 = 10 families
$2,600 = 20 families
$3,600 = 24 families

Nonetheless, we expect to be able to fully fund the program!
What if we collect more than expected?
All the money collected will be invested in the quality of life of these families whichwill be reflected in the increase of tourists who will feel safe and comfortable while staying with our rural families. Every single step we take, with your help, is a closer goal to have more families overcoming poverty.
How does the reward work?
After spending a lot of time thinking about how to reward you in the best way, for supporting our project, we have decided to include you as a member of ourcommunity. For that reason, we have created a membership system exclusively foryou.



Do you want to travel to different places of Colombia? Perhaps you plan to go to Latin America or the Caribbean? Then, this is for you.
Do you know someone who plans to travel? Help us recommending this campaign to your friends!

Some other ways to help
We know that not everyone has option to donate money but any help is veryimportant. How can you help?

Go to our fanpage and share this information.
Use the Indiegogo broadcasting tools; this will help us to have more visibility. 
Visit our Ruralive destinations in Colombia, from 2015, we will begin our expansion to other countries in Latin America and the Caribbean, so you have many options to choose from.


_________________

No queremos dejar mejoramientos de vivienda a la mitad por eso hemos decido que si no logramos reunir todo el dinero cubriremos la cantidad de familias que alcancemos a pagar con el total recaudado

$150 = 1 familia
$750 = 5 familias
$1300 = 10 familias
$2600 = 20 familias
$36000 = 24 familias

Sin embargo, estamos confiados que lograremos recaudar el total de nuestro objetivo.
¿Que pasa si recaudamos más del objetivo?
Todo el dinero que recibamos será invertido en mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrecemos para que así mas turistas quieran venir a hospedarse con nuestras familias campesinas. Cada pasito que damos, con tu ayuda, nos acerca más al objetivo de ver a muchas familia fuera de la pobreza.

RURALIVE COLOMBIA

story:
This Campaign is designed to help Kris Brandhagen to gain the remaining funds required for her to attend the Ontario College of Art and Design (OCAD) University (dream school) in Toronto. Why? To obtain her Interdisciplinary Master's of Art, Media and Design. That's a mouthful!

Kris is a Regina artist whose photography is concerned with the abstract, as well as stop motion animation. She has presented three solo exhibitions, and participated in a number of group shows and performances. Also a writer and critic, Brandhagen has been published by a number of periodicals since 2001. To see more of her work please visit brandphotography.wordpress.com or brandhagen.tumblr.com.

Kris is very proud to say that she has already obtained part time employment as a Teaching Assistant at OCAD U for the fall and winter semesters, as well as a small scholarship from the institution itself. She has been applying for all of the scholarships and bursaries that are applicable to her circumstances but her funding is still coming up a bit short.

Having juggled jobs while pursuing other educational opportunities, Kris knows that working too much while attempting to focus on full-time studies is not conducive, therefore, she is doing everything she can, including this crowdraiser, to patch together the funds necessary to attend.

The reasons for this educational step? For an artist at Kris's level of expertise and experience, completing a Master's of Fine Art (MFA) is the logical next step. This level of education shows determination and perseverance, and is one way of professionalizing the emerging artist. It is a rite of passage. With the teaching, research and publishing already moving along, Kris will likely gain work as a professor subsequently.

Why Toronto? Toronto would put Kris on the world sphere, leading to other important opportunities elsewhere. There will be brilliant networking opportunities with other arts professionals already living there as well as the many visiting artists coming through. From that position, she could conceivably make important contributions, to the art world, through exhibitions.

Many expenses go into this level of education, from tuition and fees to computer and software fees to books and supplies on top of all of the regular expenses that go along with life. Tuition and fees alone for the first year come to nearly seven thousand dollars.

Please help to get the word out and make some noise about Kris's campaign.

story:
The founding mission of Dot Girl Products is to prepare every girl for her first period.  The more girls know about the changes that will take place to their bodies during puberty, the more they will face this transition with confidence.  Learning about their bodies in a supportive way will also help girls to take control about future health decisions they will face.

We are a small company with big dreams and we want to help the many schools and organizations that ask for donated kits because of their own limited budgets. Believing that there is no time like the present to achieve our dream, we decided to turn to crowd funding to raise the necessary money to put The Dot Girl First Period Kit® into as many hands as possible.

Our goal is to donate 1200 Dot Girl kits to deserving organizations. Through your generous donations more girls will have the tools and information needed to experience their first period prepared and confident.  Together we will be able to support schools and organizations who are doing the important work of educating girls about periods. 

The Dot Girl First Period Kit®  is everything a girl needs for her first period, including information and supplies all packed in a sturdy neoprene bag. The bag has a loop for hanging and may be used month after month to store supplies in a backpack or purse. The kit is stocked with:

  • The Dot Girl Period Answer Book™ – a 20-page question and answer booklet covering the basics about menstruation including: How many days will it last? When will I get my first period? How do I track my period? What about cramps? What is a period anyway? Written in an easy-to-read and positive tone the booklet fits neatly inside the reusable bag so girls can refer to it over and over again.
  • My Period Diary – included with The Dot Girl Period Answer Book™, the Diary allows girls to track their period over the first year.
  • The Dot Girl Warm Pad™, a reusable gel heating pad for soothing cramps.
  • Five disposal bags, five feminine hygiene pads, and two hand wipes complete the kit ensuring girls that they’ll be prepared in any situation.

The Dot Girl First Period Kit® is a Mom’s Choice Awards® Gold Recipient and a winner of the coveted Parent Tested Parent Approved (PTPA) Seal of Approval.

Our family was on a motor home trip when my first period started and I had no idea what was happening. To be honest, I thought I was dying. It took about a day before I had the courage to tell my mother. An immediate, quick trip to the grocery store followed and I still remember my mom hiding the bag from my siblings and handing me a hygiene pad with minimal explanation. I vowed then that if I ever had a daughter, she would be prepared.

Twenty-eight years later and sure enough, that day arrived. One afternoon, I picked up my daughter from grade school and she hopped into the car and told me they had discussed periods in class. Her reaction, "yuck" gave me the opening I needed. On the way home, we talked about periods and the role they fill in a woman's life. She still was saying "yuck" when we got home but at least she understood that periods were just a normal step in becoming a woman. That evening I put together a small bag of supplies for her to use in case she was away from home when her first period started. I included a clean pair of underpants, feminine hygiene products and a washcloth. I had her store it in her gym bag so she would be prepared.

As it happened, she was home when her first period started, and in a very matter of fact voice, informed me what was happening. She was comfortable and I was pleased that such an anxiety-laden day for me was a simple transition for my daughter.  I realized then that other parents might need help with this delicate subject and thus was born The Dot Girl First Period Kit®.

Thank you to our wonderful sponsors for supporting this campaign. Please visit their websites to learn more about their products for women and girls.


New Moon Girls - a safe online community for girls, by girls


Dear Kate - performance underwear for high performing women

The Period Store - Monthly delivery of pads, tampons, and more.

Love the love from our sponsors!

“Our parents bought the kits for their daughters and they were a huge success.  My daughter is much more comfortable about the topic and is now excited about starting her period.”

Karenbeatrice (K) Porcher; Troop Leader – North Riverdale Girl Scout Troop #1477; Girl Scout of Greater New York

My 9 yr old daughter and I have gone through the American Girl book, "The Care & Keeping of You," some additional internet info, and "The Dot Girl First Period Kit." This kit is very nice, smallish, well-made, and includes supplies, a heating pad, hand wipes, Q&A booklet & a way to track their first year. I can see her refilling the kit and carrying it in her backpack for years. The kit is roughly 5" dia. and 1 1/2" thick. At a recent sleepover, the girls compared the kit with the information in American Girl book. I think this kit is a good healthy way for young girls to be prepared.

- Lucy, Amazon.com customer

Just a super helpful way for parents help educate and prepare their girls for one of life’s firsts.

-Kristen, CoolMomPicks.com

Thank you to Women's Health Foundation for the campaign support:

Maddy gives The Dot Girl First Period Kit a 5 out of 5 rating!


Another review, this one from a mom!


Is The Dot Girl First Period Kit® available in other languages? 

Dot Girl materials are available in English only.  Language translation services are not available at this time.

How do I tell you which school or organization should receive my donated kits?

At the end of the campaign we will send you a link to a page with a form to fill out where you can list the school or organization that should receive your donated kits.  We will also ask for a shipping address, a contact name and contact phone number. 

May I add the free kits to the donated kits so the school or organization receives more kits?

Yes, you are welcome to combine the free and donated kits and ship them together to one school or organization.  We'll ask you this question when you receive the form regarding who should receive the donated kits.

I want to donate but I am not familiar with a school or organization for the donated kits.  What should I do?

We would be happy to still accept your donation and direct it to our general donation fund for schools and organizations that call us throughout the year asking for help.  We will notify you when a donation is made to a deserving organization in your name.

How will the school or organization know that I am making the donation?

Each box of donated kits will include a letter listing your name or organization as the generous benefactor making the donation.  This letter will be generated by Dot Girl Products and cannot be personalized. You will receive a copy of the letter when the kits are shipped.

Can my donation be anonymous?

Yes, your donation can be anonymous.  We will note in the donation letter that the donated kits are from a generous benefactor and leave your name off completely. 

How does shipping within the United States work?

Free shipping is included for the free and donated kits shipping within the United States, U.S. Territories and APO addresses.  Shipments will be by United States Postal Service or UPS Ground depending on weight.

Do you ship internationally?

Yes, however our limited budget requires that we collect additional monies for international shipping.  Shipping for free kits is listed at each perk level.  Shipping for donated kits will be based on destination and weight and will be collected through PayPal once the campaign is closed.  All international shipping will be by United States Postal Service.  We appreciate your understanding of this requirement.

May I ship my free kits to more than one address?

Free kits may be shipped to only one address per donation.

May I ship the donated kits to more than one address?

Donated kits may be shipped to only one address per donation.

When will the free and donated kits be shipped?

Our manufacturing partner is standing by and excited to start producing The Dot Girl First Period Kit®.  As soon as our campaign ends, we will place our order and they will get to work.

Allowing for 20 days to receive the funds raised through the campaign we are expecting to ship the kits within three months after the end of the campaign.  And we will do everything we can to speed the process along so you receive the kits as soon as possible.  You will receive emails from the Dot Girl campaign tracking progress.

What will you do with the money you raise?

Once the campaign is closed, we'll manufacture the Dot Girl kits and ship them out as quickly as possible.  All money left over will go into a general donation fund for schools and organizations that call and ask for our help throughout the year.  These donations will be tracked on our website with a special thank you to our Indiegogo supporters.

__________________________

Dot Girl trademarks are owned by TK Designs, LLC.  All rights reserved 2014.

Like this campaign?  Please leave a comment in the comments section.  Thank you!

story:
With over 21, 000 inmates returning to Arizona’s communities each year, many community members are unaware of the challenges that a person faces when re-entering society after incarceration.  The most prevalent challenges include employment, housing, health, family reunification, education and other support for stabilization.  These barriers have a direct impact on our community’s economic health and public safety by contributing to the high rate of recidivism (number of people who end up returning to jail or prison). 

Many of these individuals lack the tools necessary to make the transition back into their communities and families, and there are a very limited number of resource providers available to assist with this process.

Life transformation is a process that begins from within.  Construction Career Training Program Arizona (CCTP-Arizona) offers our participants essential tools for building a firm foundation as the first step in this process. 

The Construction Career Training Program (CCTP) was founded in Minnesota in 2002 by David Adolfson, Chairman Emeritus at Adolfson & Peterson Construction, as a faith-based program to help formerly incarcerated individuals learn construction trades and find work in the industry.  Today, CCTP has headquarters in Minnesota and Arizona.  The Arizona division has successfully served more than 110 individuals, ages 18 through 68, since August 2014. Our program focuses on the future of our participants, rather than their past.  CCTP Arizona provides:

·  Biblically-based Life Skills Training

·  Mentor-led Support Groups

·  Workforce Readiness Training

·  Employment Placement Assistance

·  Referrals for Support Resources

These services are provided for formerly incarcerated adults, as well as young adults who are at-risk for entering the criminal justice system due to poverty, limited education, limited opportunities and other negative social barriers.

As a result of our work, Arizona will experience an overall reduction in the statewide recidivism rate, communities healing as crime decreases, and a savings of millions of dollars to the citizens and taxpayers, as formerly incarcerated men and women grow to be respected, successful, and contributing members of their communities. Arizona is also experiencing an increase in the number of trained employees in the construction industry.

For more information about CCTP Arizona, or how to support this organization, please visit our website at www.cctparizona.org, or call 480-744-6354.
story_txt:
With over 21, 000 inmates returning to Arizona’s communities
each year, many community members are unaware of the challenges that a person
faces when re-entering society after incarceration.  The most prevalent challenges include
employment, housing, health, family reunification, education and other support
for stabilization.  These barriers have a
direct impact on our community’s economic health and public safety by
contributing to the high rate of recidivism (number of people who end up
returning to jail or prison).  
Many of these individuals lack the tools necessary to make
the transition back into their communities and families, and there are a very
limited number of resource providers available to assist with this process. 
Life transformation is a process that begins from within.  Construction
Career Training Program Arizona (CCTP-Arizona) offers our participants
essential tools for building a firm foundation as the first step in this
process.  
The Construction Career Training Program (CCTP) was founded
in Minnesota in 2002 by David Adolfson, Chairman Emeritus at Adolfson &
Peterson Construction, as a faith-based program to help formerly incarcerated
individuals learn construction trades and find work in the industry.  Today, CCTP has headquarters in Minnesota and
Arizona.  The Arizona division has successfully
served more than 110 individuals, ages 18 through 68, since August 2014. Our
program focuses on the future of our participants, rather than their past.  CCTP Arizona provides:
· 
Biblically-based Life Skills Training
· 
Mentor-led Support Groups
· 
Workforce Readiness Training
· 
Employment Placement Assistance
· 
Referrals for Support Resources
These services are provided for formerly incarcerated
adults, as well as young adults who are at-risk for entering the criminal
justice system due to poverty, limited education, limited opportunities and
other negative social barriers.
As a result of our work, Arizona will experience an overall
reduction in the statewide recidivism rate, communities healing as crime
decreases, and a savings of millions of dollars to the citizens and taxpayers,
as formerly incarcerated men and women grow to be respected, successful, and
contributing members of their communities. Arizona is also experiencing an increase in the number of trained employees in the construction industry.
For more information about CCTP Arizona, or how to support
this organization, please visit our website at www.cctparizona.org, or call
480-744-6354.

story:
We are a group of university students that want to make a little but important change in our society, that's why we are working with ROTARAC ESEN Santa Tecla. We live in El Salvador, Central America and as many people know our country needs a lot of investment in education. We decided to help a school located, in a rural area in Comasagua called "Las Granadillas", that needs a computer center to give a better education to their students.

This school houses 500 children from kindergarden to ninth grade who will benefit from computer classes and a place to store books that everyone can use. We think this is important because by giving these kids the opportunity to learn something that is useful and necessary nowadays, we are improving their chances of getting into college and having a better job. 


What we need
We want to go step by step, to start the project we need $500. The school has an available field for the construction and we need the money for all the materials required.


Ways you can help

Please help us share this campaign. Thanks for your help.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Hugh Willard. I am a psychotherapist and author of The Goodwill Vultures Club book series. I wrote this chapter book series with a few key objectives in mind. First, I wanted to increase awareness and understanding about persons with special needs. This goes a long ways towards increasing acceptance and empathy for folks who are different. Second, I hoped to capture the interest and love of reading for elementary aged boys. Statistics consistently show a precipitous drop in reading for our young men by the time they reach the middle grades. The resulting negative impacts are far reaching. Finally, I also wished to help the greater public better understand the central role that animals serve in our lives and well-being. To these ends, I am conducting this crowdfunding campaign, titled “Special People, Special Pets”. I hope to raise money to bulk purchase the first book in the series, “A Day of Heroes”. 

What We Need & What You Get

All of the funds will go to buy the books at cost. The books will be donated to Bonnie’s Book Foundation. This is a wonderful local non-profit agency supporting children’s literacy by giving books to children from low income families. They also support local schools and other programs that serve at-risk youth. As an incentive, if you make a donation of $50, I will send you a signed copy of A Day of Heroes. For a $100 donation, I will send you signed copies of the full Goodwill Vultures Club series (3 volumes).

The Impact

My intention is to use 100% of the funds raised towards the purchase of the books to donate. My goal is to raise $1000. After Indiegogo’s administrative costs, this should buy about 128 books. The more money raised, the more books that will be purchased. I will receive no profit from the purchase of the books. This will increase the number that can be bought and given to the kids. If the funds goal is not reach, the good news is we will still use all of the monies to buy books for the children.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to financially contribute, I can still use your help. The more we can spread the word about this campaign, the more interest and support we can garner. Would you please consider letting your family, friends, and colleagues know about this worthwhile effort? I thank you in advance for helping in this important project.

story:
Hey, my name’s Tyler Hall. I’m a 21 year old college student at Aurora University, trying to pay my own way through college. Currently, I am working on my Coaching and Youth Sport Development degree while trying to work on campus and stay in shape.



     I’ve started this campaign to assist me in funding a once in a lifetime trip to Europe. My newly made friend/teammate, Scott Lasowski, and I are going to Berlin, Germany,  May 11th- May 27th, to stay with another friend/former teammate, Jan Zawadzki, who’s family lives there. Scott is just graduating and I haven't been able to see Jan in years. Jan's family has been kind enough to let us stay in their home over the two weeks we will be there. We want to visit the multiple tourists’ sites and see the  country of Germany, visit another friend of mine in Denmark, and attend a Polish wedding in Poland with Scott’s and my current roommate. I’ve
already paid for my ticket earlier in the year, but due to the cost of rent and food (& possibly the inexperience of living on my own), I am out of money for this trip and am in desperate need of your help!



 

     I’ve chosen to set the Total Goal Amount of this campaign at $500, and any amount of donation will be greatly appreciated and extremely helpful! I promise that the money donated will be used for good intention and won’t be used carelessly. Thank you for your time and support!

story:
DID YOU WATCH THE VIDEO?? (above)

What happens when two moms -  a curriculum-writing Educator/Administrator and an entrepreneurial Fundraiser/Major Event Planner put their minds together? Pure Excellence! 

But, when you throw in that they are both Bronx, NY natives?

Well...the Sky's the Limit!

    • Entrepreneurs create 75% of all new jobs in our economy. 
    • 7 out of 10 high school students want to start their own companies.
    • Less than 25% of high school students are offered a business or entrepreneurial course by the time they graduate.

    The Mission of Sky’s the Limit Youth Academy is to create a mentor-guided, exploratory, educational environment where, through a supportive community of their peers, young people can develop a deeper level of creativity, self-expression and entrepreneurial awareness that leads to business ownership.

    SKY’S Aims To:

    1. To be the most successful organization in the Baltimore Metropolitan area that serves as a vehicle of professional influence, knowledge attainment, and access to community resources for young people
    2. To increase the number of youth-owned businesses by providing initial support and funding to high potential business concepts
    3. To provide a franchise opportunity to teach, train, and model business owners’ habits of success to senior program participants 

    Unlike many other Entrepreneurship-focused programs,

    SKY'S goes beyond just business concepts and focuses on exposing our participants to a variety of learning opportunities and "Habits of Success".

    SKY'S leverages the relationships with our community partners to provide needed resources for our participants.

    SKY'S Success Coaches work with each of our Executives to brainstorm, plan, develop, and fully execute viable businesses.

    15 week SKY’S Habits of Success Workshop Series™ (Senior Executives)

    This 15 week program meets 1x/ week for up to 4 hours. The workshop sessions are interactive learning experiences that build upon business planning, leadership development, and the qualities of successful entrepreneurship. Every workshop will be delivered by a business owner or industry professional. (Ages 12- 15)

    *Begins February 2015

    Curriculum Components:

    • Entrepreneurship and Leadership
    • Community Service and Social Responsibility
    • Health and Wellness-Mind, Body, and Spirit
    • Confidence and Pride
    • Appearance and Hygiene
    • Culture (Music and Arts)
    • Financial Management
    • Higher Education
    • Spirituality
    • Laws and Civil Obedience

    Community Business Showcase and Investment Circle (Senior Executives)

    See the Executive's business come to life at Sky's the Limit Youth Academy's Annual Community Business showcase. During this event, our participants will shine side-by-side with community leaders, business owners, and corporate sponsors.  Start-up funding of up to $5,000 will be awarded to our Senior Executive with the highest potential business concept.

    * June 2015

    Silver Lining Matriculation™ (Senior Executives)

    Formal ceremony to acknowledge and recoginize the hard work, commitment, and dedication of our Senior Executive program graduates. 

    * June 2015

    Camp Success™ (Junior Executives)

    Camp Success allows our Junior Executives (ages 8 - 11) the opportunity to build business concepts with other aspiring young entrepreneurs. Our Habits of Success curriculum will be used to guide small module learning combined with recreational and social activities. Camp Success will be a 2 week full day summer camp program. 

    * Summer 2015

    Year Round Leadership Forums and Activities

    SKY'S will inflitrate the Baltimore Metropolitan community with youth-centered monthly learning forums, speaker series, school-based activities, assemblies, pep rallies, and trainings in partnership with community organizations.

    * Beginning December 2014

    Through entrepreneurship education, young people learn organizational skills, leadership development and interpersonal skills, all of which are highly transferable skills sought by employers. Other positive outcomes include:

    • improved academic performance, school attendance; and educational attainment
    • increased problem-solving and decision-making abilities
    • improved interpersonal relationships, teamwork, money management, and public speaking skills
    • job readiness
    • enhanced social psychological development (self-esteem, ego development, self-efficacy), and
    • perceived improved health status
    (US Dept. of Labor)

      We have developed a comprehensive fundraising plan to meet the needs of the organization in Year 1. Our fundraising launches with this crowdfunding initiative.  Reaching our goal here will allow us to begin our programming, offered at NO COST to participants, according to our outlined schedule. 

      A successful campaign will allow us to begin the application process for SKY'S. This fundraising campaign will culminate HERE:

      Check out the great "perks" you can receive with your donation! However, the VERY BEST REWARD will be your ability to make a mark in the lives of young people. You will be helping us (albeit one step at a time) move toward a society where every child has a chance to prove his/her worth. THAT, will be PRICELESS.

      We've been VERY busy! To date, we:

      • Launched our official Facebook and Twitter pages and a YouTube Channel. 
      • Released our new website at www.skysthelimityouthacademy.org 
      • Entered into a relationship/ partnership with the Rehoboth International Covenant Church (RICC) in Randallstown, Maryland. Through their generosity, we have secured office space!

      Visit our website to learn more!

      Thank you for your support. Any and every donation will help. However, while we know some people just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean they can’t help.

      Please help us make some noise about our campaign! We'd appreciate that kind of support as well!

improved academic performance, school attendance; and educational attainment

improved interpersonal relationships, teamwork, money management, and public speaking skills
job readiness
enhanced social psychological development (self-esteem, ego development, self-efficacy), and
perceived improved health status

(US Dept. of Labor)
  
  We have developed a comprehensive fundraising plan to meet the needs of the organization in Year 1. Our fundraising launches with this crowdfunding initiative.  Reaching our goal here will allow us to begin our programming, offered at NO COST to participants, according to our outlined schedule. 
A successful campaign will allow us to begin the application process for SKY'S. This fundraising campaign will culminate HERE:




Check out the great "perks" you can receive with your donation! However, the VERY BEST REWARD will be your ability to make a mark in the lives of young people. You will be helping us (albeit one step at a time) move toward a society where every child has a chance to prove his/her worth. THAT, will be PRICELESS.

  


We've been VERY busy! To date, we:



Launched our official Facebook and Twitter pages and a YouTube Channel. 


Released our new website at www.skysthelimityouthacademy.org 


Entered into a relationship/ partnership with the Rehoboth International Covenant Church (RICC) in Randallstown, Maryland. Through their generosity, we have secured office space!


Visit our website to learn more!
Thank you for your support. Any and every donation will help. However, while we know some people just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean they can’t help.
Please help us make some noise about our campaign! We'd appreciate that kind of support as well!

story:
We sweetened the deal!



             And we're giving back...






       Can PawPaw change the world?

A dog? A world changer? Oh yes. Please meet PawPaw, star of the Adventures With PawPaw children’s book series. PawPaw travels the world introducing young readers to other countries and cultures.

                                      

The plan

We've already published 3 books in the Adventures With PawPaw series -- China, Costa Rica, and France. And now we want to publish 2 more books in the series: Italy and Kenya!

Will you help us? If you believe:

  • It’s important to introduce young kids to the world around them…
  • The world needs a little more love (and a loveable pooch to do that)….
...then please join us! We'll use our Indiegogo funds to write 2 more books in the series, create brilliant illustrations, then print and publish the books for kiddos all over the world.

                                          

    The perks

    Everyone who funds our campaign at the $25 or higher level gets a signed set of the original 3 books in the PawPaw series -- and LOTS more!

    You can also help by:

    • Sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
    • Using the Indiegogo share tools!
    If you believe kids are the same no matter what color their skin or what they eat for breakfast, join our campaign today!

                                                          

    The impact

    A portion of sales from the Adventures With PawPaw series goes to the Born2Fly Project to stop child trafficking. We love kids and we're committed to protect them, including from the horrific evil of child trafficking.

                                                                              * * *

                                     

                                             from Adventures With PawPaw: China

                                        

                                           from Adventures With PawPaw: Costa Rica

                                          

                                                  from Adventures With PawPaw: France
